198 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
2
Non recommandé
18.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 mars 2015
I was lured in by all the positive reviews and the beautiful art style. Once I started playing, I really tried to love this game. I really tried. I got thirteen levels in before I couldn't escape that I hate this game more than any game I can ever remember hating.

There are a lot of reasons why. Many are nitpicks, but there is one overwhelming one: This Game Is Almost Never Fun. I started out enthusiastic, but it wasn't long before all the enjoyment drained out. I went from looking forward to the next level, to only wanting to complete the current one just so it would be over and done with. I could not help contrast Tri with games like Portal or QUBE where, most of the time, the challenge is in figuring out the puzzle. Once you know how it's done, you can do it. In Tri, this is not the case. Realizing the solution just means understanding how much tiring, precarious, exacting, chore-like work you have to do before you can DO the thing you figured out how to do. This is a game where there is no such thing as a simple solution. If solving a puzzle can be made more difficult, it has been. Not in a mentally challenging way, but in a way that feels like having to walk for miles over uneven rocks. (Especially once they introduced having to direct light beams by reflecting them off triangles. This requires innumerable microscopic adjustments each time.)

And even that would be fully forgiveable, if the game's difficulty was FAIR. For me, half my frustration came from the increasingly difficult puzzles, the other half came from inconsistent mechanics. Sometimes when I had to run up walls, a triangle that showed I could walk on it would suddenly let go of me and I'd plummet. Sometimes I got trapped in places I should have been able to jump out of. Sometimes lasers would bleed right through triangles I put up to block them (In one case, I had to layer down twenty-four of them). But the worst was the jump. At first I thought it was a nifty idea that if you were jumping towards a high ledge, you could keep pressing space to haul yourself up and over. I grew to hate this mechanic because of how often it failed. Jumping up a simple step could take five or six tries; impotently bobbing up and down going "HUHHP! HUHHP! HUHHP!" each time. There were also plenty of times when it seemed like random chance whether a given platform could be jumped to or not. Plus there was the tendency of jumps to send you up and over a thin ledge you were trying to reach, instead of onto. I quicksaved OFTEN.

Tri feels like it lives up to its name: they tried. They really did. They had ideas with a lot of potential and the level design is frequently gorgeous. But too often these ideas were implemented poorly, or were not conveyed at a reasonable difficulty level. I quit. I don't want to, and I am massively disappointed to, but I'm giving up and uninstalling this game. I know I'll never see the end cutscene, but honestly, not playing anymore feels like more of a reward to me.
 
Alex Reynard
8

Recommandé
17.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 janvier 2016
This, is what I define as a "Hidden Gem". By 8th Jan 2016, the game only received 150+ reviews on steam, which is far from a satisfactory number compared to its excellence. What a Pity.

The game, TRI: Of Friendship and Madness, is possibly the best First Person Puzzler I have played in 5 years (since Portal 2). Of course, as to artistic merit (which is clearly not the main focus of this game anyway), this game falls far behind titles like Talos Principle or Antichamber. However, when it comes to gameplay, especially level design, this game is definitely among the best ones in the category.

Like every other hidden gems, this game is flawed, every outstanding aspect of the game, is accompanied by something not properly done which I'll break into details in the following paragraphs. Nonetheless, as I always believe, with flaws come the personality and sincerity, which are the criterions I used to define good works.


【Mechanism】

Goods: The core mechanism and most puzzles are cleverly designed, both logically and aesthetically. It's a rare one in the First Person Puzzler category that really nailed the 3D thinking, I mean, seriously into a 6DOF level. Let's take a look back, a sad fact is that a large portion of puzzles in other First Person Puzzlers can be easily recreated in a 2D format. (Yes, I'm specifically referring to the base game of Talos Principle here) But not in this game, the refreshing experience you would have when walking upside-down on the ceiling, is as inspiring as Portal provided years ago.

Bads: While the core mechanism gives you a large degree of freedom, it can also be easily exploited and overused. In more than one circumstance，I accidentally broke the puzzle with some tricky/cheaty methods, which I'm pretty sure is not the intended way. It might be welcomed by some players, but I personally do not like it. It's as if I broke the game along with its immersion and gaming context, which makes me feel retar*ed, especially after I discovered the legit way to solve it later on.


【Level Design】

Goods: Levels (after the first few ones) are huge and imaginative, full of secrets and alternative paths, the most important of all: WITHOUT ANY NAVIGATION ( or maybe a minimum amount of). This might sounds like a downside for modern gamers, but undoubtedly a diamond for nostalgic gamers like me. The game has all kinds of surprise in full stock waiting for you here and there , which simply gives you a sense of adventure and exploration, in your full control, unlike any other roller coaster experiences modern games would provide. It's hard not to relate this game to those old school classic FPS of the 90s with identical elements, such a sweet déjà vu.

Bads: Although I speak highly of its overall level design, the first few levels of the game are rather tedious and uninspiring, which I'm afraid is the major reason that prevented more people from knowing the game. But trust me, if you are patient enough to make it through the first quarter of the game, you will be amazed by how ambitious and imaginative the latter levels are.


【Sound Design】

Goods: Another thing worth mentioning is the soundtracks, which is definitely not the best but certainly among the most special tracks I have heard in video games. They are not those generic ambient/drone tracks you would normally expect in the puzzle game genre, but some world/tribal music instead. Some of them do also have an alienated context within that contributed greatly to the theme of the game.

Bads: But strangely, half the tracks end so suddenly with a harsh fadeout, almost feel like unfinished. And what's worse, is the vocal sound effects of the player controlled character, which is laughably bad. If by any luck the developers can read this, I seriously suggest you guys to take a second look on that. For it is, by far, the shortest plank of the game I can come up with.



So conclusively, if you're looking for an awe-inspiring experience and have enough patience and tolerance for those aformentioned flaws in the game, you would not regret to give it a try. Additionally, for achievement hunters out there like me, this is also a must-buy, for there is no grinding achievement at all but all gameplay boosters.





[All Achievements Acquired on: 1 Jan, 2016]
[Final (Subjective) Verdict: 86%]
 
Serotoninphobe

Évaluation publiée le 10 janvier 2015
Пойдём от плохого к хорошему.
Локализация:
Плохая. Ошибки встречаются довольно часто.
Сюжет:
Ничего особенного в нём нет, никаких тайн и интриг. Можно сказать, что он здесь для галочки.
Графика:
Среднего качества, но для этой игры большего и не нужно.
Визуальный Стиль:
На любителя. Я, например, очень уважаю сюрреализм, посему мне было приятно играть.
Саундтрек:
Он отлично гармонирует с визуальным стилем и, мягко говоря, необычен. Мне он, конечно же, понравился.
Головоломки:
Вот то ради чего стоит приобретать эту игру. Я как любитель головоломок от первого лица (и любых других головоломок) просто в восторге. 16 уровней, на протяжении которых нам преподносят всё больше и больше способов использования нашего устройства TRI.
Итог:
Рекомендую любителям головоломок.
 
grizzly9955

Évaluation publiée le 21 avril 2017
I never would thought i would get motion sickness from playing a first person puzzler yet. I ended up with a terrible headache and motion sickness at least 4 times for this game.

Yet.. it's so magical that I fail to put it down so many time. It's just so beautiful and so smart the way all the level and puzzles goes together. Once you pass the easy first few levels it gets harder and harder and triangle/laser will haunt your dream if you fail to solve the puzzles. Every time I found one of those missing statue I scream out "hell ya!"

In china and behind the great firewall I don't have access to utube unless I use VPN which I try to avoid as much as possible. This game without utube hint will burn your mind and time like no other. I look at all the people that review this game and have a 100% completion timer of 10-40 hours. And then I look at my own playing record of over 100+ hours...
I tell myself I need to play more of this game and get smarter....

9/10 and thanks for helping me get smarter and no thanks for the headache of hard puzzles.

 
wany1981

Recommandé
44.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 décembre 2015
非常喜欢这款游戏，做了狐狸和idols全收集通关的视频攻略：
http://www.bilibili.com/video/av3327108/

游戏内容：
游戏讲述了神仙红狐狸被疯狂侵袭失去理智，而它的蓝朋友为了回复往日，指导引领着主角步上拯救它的道路。

故事并不是重点，即使不看也没有大碍。主要游戏内容分为16个关卡，每个关卡内收集到三个狐狸雕塑作为打开通向下一关传送门的钥匙。其间每个关卡的地图上都分散有许多收集要素，玩家需要细心才能寻找到它们。三个狐狸雕塑并不难寻，游戏自带标记它们地点的功能，所以我认为游戏主要乐趣在于探索空间，集齐收集要素的金光闪闪小雕塑。

亮点：
除了清新简约又美丽的画风，这个游戏的最大亮点莫过于它独特的玩法：玩家可以自己画出三角形作为踏足之地。这可能会让人想起二维平面作品《蜡笔物理学（CRAYON PHYSICS）》，不过《仨》里的三角形并不是随便画的，你需要满足三个点每个点间的间距不可以超过规定范围，造出来的平面不可以和自己目前的重力平面形成过大的角度，不然这个平面即使造出来了也不是黄色，而是红色的，代表着不可以附着。

可以自己随意绘制三角形意味着游戏给玩家提供了某种程度上来说莫大的自由度，只要有技巧有耐心，你可以到达这个封闭空间的地图上的任意位置！欣赏顶点的风景，探索旮旯的犄角！


音乐上，属于异域风情风格的类型，有点印度、阿拉伯味道（？），虽然和游戏整体风格比起来配乐的类型有点怪怪的，但是挺好听的。所有歌曲的歌词都是那么简单的几个句子反复吟唱，并且中文空耳极其严重，每首歌都像不明所以的中文歌曲！例如第一首，歌词是“人类的足迹”，后面还有“京巴是牙医~~京巴是牙医~~京巴你呀~~哦~~嗷噢~~”。。。

吐槽：
单单从解谜爱好者的角度来说的话，这个游戏其实没什么解谜，主要还是建造与探索，寻找隐藏的雕塑，更像是捉迷藏游戏（？）
4分（满分5）
 
lililili
767 produits enregistrés
2
77 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
9.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 octobre 2014
Tri Of Friendship And Madness is yet another puzzle game shown from a first person perspective. I love these kind of games. But is it as memorable as the Portal games or Q.U.B.E. ? Maybe. Let’s find out.

Tri drops you into the world of the Odd Gods where you have to complete 16 stages in order to find out what happened to two of the foxes that once inhabited the world. You’re being guided by a ghostly figure that gives you cryptic advice and messages. In each of the levels presented your goal is to collect the three hidden fox statues and to put them on their pedestal. Once all three statues have been placed on the pedestal you’ll be able to exit the current level and progress to the next one.
The game has a soothing and relaxing atmosphere. You can take your time; there’s no rush, but if you want you can beat your previous ‘records’ by replaying a level as quickly as possible, by collecting all of the hidden idols or by using the minimum amount of triangles. These triangles are an important part of the gameplay, so let me tell you a little more about it.
Your character carries a device that allows him to create triangular platforms. You can do this by pointing and clicking the mouse. The game will automatically complete the platform once three points have been placed but you have to take into account that there are many rules that make it impossible to ‘just’ create a platform. No, that would be too easy. For example, you can’t create platforms on wood. You also can’t create platforms in ‘corrupted’ spaces, and since the platforms created are in 2D (remember that you can only place a maximum of 3 ‘entry’ points) there’s no real depth or thickness in them. There are more factors to take into account, but I’m not going too far into this. It’s something you’ll experience and see for yourself.
Each level also has an amount of golden idols to collect. These are usually hidden in places you normally can’t reach so you have to carefully set up your platforms in order to be able to collect these. They don’t add anything to the experience, but it’s a fun side activity nevertheless.
A new ‘power’ will also unlock every couple of levels. The first one obviously allows you to create the platforms themselves, but the second one will allow you to walk on walls by carefully placing your triangles. There’s also a power that will let you redirect light and teleport.
The first couple of levels are very simple and can be finished in a matter of minutes. Halfway through the game becomes a bit harder and completing a level can then take anywhere between 15-60 minutes. Since you’re able to walk on walls after just a few hours of playing you can imagine it can get quite complicated; the camera will rotate often and some people might experience motion sickness because of it.
The puzzles are actually very fun - and sometimes also very challenging – to solve. You can’t die, so you can experiment as much as you want. You won’t fall to your death and you won’t get killed by enemies (because there are none). The mysterious story and characters make you want to keep playing, just to see what might’ve happened. The story isn’t 'in-your-face'; you have to think for yourself here, so it makes for a good incentive. A job well done, if you ask me.

The graphics are simple with relatively basic geometry. Graphically it reminded me of the game Kairo; it uses the same kind of soft graphics. But there certainly are more colors to be found in the world of Tri. Some of the levels also have a Japanese atmosphere, because of the lighting, use of colors and some of the objects in it (like lanterns). The visuals won’t blow your mind, but they definitely get the job done.
And the music: well, the music is… different. I thought that there were a lot of ‘world music’ influences in the game, with music similar to African and Japanese ‘tunes’. It’s subtle and not ‘in-your-face’, but it’s definitely something you’ll notice while playing. There are practically no sounds, with just a ‘hnnng’ sound for jumping and sounds for creating triangles. It’s all very basic stuff.
The voice acting is also limited (so far) to only one character. But this person does quite a decent job at pulling off a convincing, yet mysterious, character.

The length depends on your skill and intelligence. Some might finish it in 10 hours I think, others (like me) might take a little longer. Some levels are harder than you might think, and even though I’ve been stuck on the same puzzle for a few hours now I’m still enjoying it. Maybe because there’s no time limit or the fact that I can do what I want, trying to figure things out at my own pace. In any case, it’s a good sign. The length is perfectly fine for a game with this price.

Yes, yes; Tri is yet another game that can be added to the list of already excellent first person puzzle games like Portal and Q.U.B.E. It introduces a new gameplay mechanic that’s original and one that works surprisingly well, even in puzzle format. The mysterious atmosphere makes you want to keep playing and the increasingly difficult puzzles are(mostly) fun to solve.
All in all this is a great game for puzzle enthusiasts.

If you enjoyed this review please consider following me: curator page
 
mark | dj.
4,467 produits enregistrés
3
25 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
26.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 novembre 2019
Вы находитесь в странном коридоре, выложенном желтой плиткой. Дорога впереди становится с каждым шагом всё круче и круче, затем превращается в стену, а еще выше загибается назад и вовсе теряется из виду. Справа от вас из стены вырывается смертоносный лазерный луч, который пересекает коридор поперёк и впивается в волшебный кристалл, тем самым открывая один из четырех таинственных замков. Ещё три таких же кристалла находятся на постаментах дальше по коридору, и вам нужно пронзить каждый из них насквозь. Вы оцениваете размеры помещения и размечаете перед собой три точки, одну на полу и две на стене. Между ними сами собой протягиваются линии, которые становятся сторонами треугольника с непроницаемой отражающей поверхностью. Луч врезается в препятствие и рикошетит в сторону. Тогда вы начинаете двигать вершины треугольника, меняя угол его наклона и манипулируя направлением лазера. Теперь луч указывает в нужную сторону. Вы следуете за ним и подправляете его поток еще одним отражателем. И еще одним, и еще. Вскоре уклон коридора становится слишком крутым. Тогда вы рисуете треугольник на полу и встаете на него. Затем вы выкладываете дорожку из треугольников, больших и малых, остроугольных и тупоугольных. И начинаете смело по ним шагать. Кажется, ничего особенного не происходит. Вот только вы почему-то идёте по отвесной стене. Еще пара шагов - и вы на потолке. Гравитация больше не работает, ваши подошвы приклеены в поверхностям геометрических фигур. Наконец, вы высвечиваете все кристаллы, провожаете луч назад, в начало, и добиваете первую цель. Поздравляю, вы завершили одно из самых простых заданий 14 уровня TRI. Для большинства других испытаний от вас потребуются не только ловкость, терпение и хорошая ориентация в пространстве, но и изощренное остроумие.

Немецкий программист Фридрих Ханиш впервые реализовал основополагающую идею TRI в 2011 году на игровой джем-сессии, темой которой была фраза "It's dangerous to go alone. Take this". В его простенькой игре «этим» были треугольники, которые можно использовать как платформы, липучки или отражатели. Затем Ханиш и его напарница, художница Яна Рейнхардт подумали: если один человек смог создать функциональный прототип за 48 часов, то двое людей наверняка сумеют сделать полноценную игру этак за 48 дней. Они промахнулись в своих расчетах всего на 3 года.

Игра вышла в 2014 году, когда волна интереса к головоломкам от первого лица, запущенная Portal и подстёгнутая его сиквелом, достигла своего пика. Всего через два месяца после TRI в продажу поступил знаменитый Talos Principle. И с ним эту игру очень удобно сравнивать. Не потому что она хуже или лучше, а из-за их кардинально разных подходов к презентации и коммуникации с игроком.

В Talos загадки и головоломки помещены в карантин отдельных арен. Мы словно листаем учебник и выполняем одну за другой задачки, где правила игры прописаны черным по белому. В TRI нет ничего очевидного. Каждый уровень вырастает вокруг нас словно тюрьма. Мы заворачиваемся в него слой за слоем, как Гарри Гудини, собирающийся совершить очередное чудесное спасение из хитроумной ловушки. Уровни напоминают японские шкатулки с секретом - только открывающиеся изнутри, а не снаружи.

Talos прилагает огромные усилия, чтобы создать для нас максимально комфортные условия. Старинная архитектура, девственная природа, чистое небо, легкая музыка. Пока мы думаем над решением задачи, нас ничего не должно отвлекать. В TRI отвлекает всё. Ярчайшие цвета контрастируют друг с другом и жадно впиваются вам в глаза. Перспектива колеблется и искажается при быстрых движениях. Воздух наполнен частицами треугольной космической пыли. Дикая, первобытная музыка агрессивно наваливается на игрока, вопит, ревет и визжит о тотальной ненормальности происходящего.

Музыка Людвига Ханиша, брата Фридриха, заслуживает отдельного внимания. Ему был заказан мистический, мифологический саундтрек, и он отнёсся к работе со всей серьезностью. Из использованных им инструментов можно составить коллекцию этнографического музея. Маримба – вариация ксилофона родом из Мексики. Малийский барабан джембе, на котором отбивают ритм руками. Калимба – маленький волшебный африканский щипковый инструмент. Варган, который прикладывают ко рту, а потом с помощью дыхания и движения большого пальца извлекают растянутое вибрирующее звучание. А заодно и более традиционные барабаны и тарелки, акустические инструменты, соло на электрогитаре. Всё это скомпоновано на компьютере и уложено вдоль басовой линии. Среди множества названных источников вдохновения особенно выделяется музыка к фильму «Акира». Эти безумные ритуальные песнопения, выворачивающие разум наизнанку. Музыка Ханиша легкомысленна и игрива, но рассказывает она явно не о том, как играем мы, а о том, как играют с нами.

Первые уровни стараются вести игрока за руку и подсказывают порядок прохождения, но потом игра снимает тренировочные колёса. Новые локации дезориентируют своей свободой, размерами и новыми невиданными способами усложнить игроку жизнь. Способность создавать треугольники в неограниченных количествах, обклеиватб ими уровни, развешивать между плоскостями, цепляя вершины углов к поверхностям – все это индивидуализирует игровой процесс и делает его невероятно творческим. По игре можно изучать характер игроков. Один найдёт оптимальный, эффективный путь, другой многократно усложнит задачу и вместо трех треугольников нарисует тридцать три.

Свободу игрока ограничивают лишь предметы из «реального мира». К деревянным стенам невозможно цеплять светящиеся треугольники. Материя будто отторгает эти измышления больного разума. Еще в игре есть банальные деревянные коробки, которые якобы подчиняются законам физики, но почти ничего не весят. Поэтому немногочисленные пазлы с их участием превращаются в мучительную комедию положений.

На протяжении всего прохождения вы будете раз за разом улетать в пропасти, но это совершенно не опасно. Ведь в стране богов нет низа. Строения просто покачиваются в мыльном разноцветном эфире. Вы сразу же переродитесь рядом с местом падения. Однако, во второй трети игры появляются бассейны с кислотой, а потом и лазерные лучи, которые «убивают насмерть» и вынуждают загружать последнее сохранение. Да, после нескольких часов игра напоминает, что её можно и нужно сохранять, иначе вас ждут неприятные сюрпризы. Автосохранения здесь имеются, но слишком редкие, так что полагаться на них не стоит.

С большинством товарищей по жанру TRI объединяет убеждение, что механики важнее всего. Их изобретательность и безупречная функциональность составляют основу игры. Вокруг этого каркаса строится эстетика. И уже готовый мир получает оправдание своему существованию: его населяют персонажами, наполняют историями, придумывают игроку мотивацию. Первоначальная версия TRI выглядела куда более традиционно, происходила в более человечном мире. Готова была альфа-версия, несколько уровней с красивыми текстурами и атмосферными декорациями европейского средневековья. Но привязка к реальности ограничивала фантазию создателей и геометрию их творений. Поэтому всё это было уничтожено ради абстрактного мира хмельных тригонометрических фантазий.

Сюжет рассказывает о двух волшебных лисицах, этаких синтоистских духах кицуне, которые неисчислимые вечности провели в беззаботных играх на границе реальностей. Но однажды один из них заигрался с треугольниками и бесследно исчез в мире Странных Богов, где высшие силы городят башни и лабиринты, мельницы и тюрьмы из праздного любопытства. Слабовольные существа скорее потеряют рассудок, чем выберутся из этой головоломки богов. Вас, послушника небольшого храма, обеспокоенный монах безответственно кидает в пучину этого безумия. Вы должны найти рыжего лиса, вытащить его оттуда, как игромана из казино, и вернуть домой, где непутёвого духа дожидается верный друг.

Такой мотивации мне хватило, чтобы пройти все 16 уровней игры и безнадежно сломать себе мозги об ее изощренные испытания.

Больше слов!
 
ChrisMarlowe
527 produits enregistrés

1
Recommandé
10.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 octobre 2014
TRI a eu une enfance difficile. Je veux dire, je saurais même plus vous dire quand j'ai pris la décision de le backer/précommander sur Desura, ni combien de fois sa sortie a été repoussée. Une chose est sûre : ça date méchamment. J'ai joué au jeu à divers stades de son évolution, et je n'ai qu'une chose à dire : de plutôt franchement carrément pas mal, il est devenu incontournable aujourd'hui.

TRI, c'est l'Anti-Kairo. Difficile de ne pas faire le rapprochement entre les deux jeux, mais la similitude n'est que superficielle : contrairement à Kairo, TRI a des choses à dire, des challenges à proposer, un but, une histoire. Loin de se perdre dans le contemplatif, il fait de celui-ci une partie de son background, et rajoute des tas de trucs par-dessus.

De quoi s'agit-t-il ? D'un jeu de euh... réflexion/plates-formes/création-de-plates-formes ? Quelque chose comme ça ?

TRI vous permet en fait de créer des triangles (des noms de jeux comme ça, c'est HYPER recherché. J'aime. O_O) qui vous serviront à avancer de diverses manières : plates-formes simples au départ, il révéleront au fur et à mesure des tableaux d'autres possibilités, un peu à la manière d'un Portal qui s'ouvre au fur et à mesure.

L'ambiance est... unique. Ce n'est pas un superlatif : c'est une constatation. RIEN ne ressemble à TRI, que ce soit dans son design sonore zen sous amphétamines ou dans ses visuels Playskool pour les grands. Oui, ça fait pas mal d'oxymores. En même temps c'est difficile de le décrire autrement.

Quid de la durée de vie ? Eh bien ça, ça dépend de vous. Dans chaque tableau sont cachés trois renards que vous devrez trouver afin d'ouvrir le portail de sortie - et ça, ça va très très vite - et une bonne grosse poignée d'idoles parfaitement inutiles et vicieusement planquées dans des recoins à se taper la tête au mur. Et ça, ça fait violemment grimper la durée de chaque tableau.

Mais pourquoi courir après si c'est inutile ? Parce que c'est inutile. Parce que vous savez que vous le voulez et si vous ne le savez pas maintenant vous le savez : vous voudrez. Parce que ça débloque du contenu bonus. Parce que les tableaux sont tellement bourrés de petits recoins planqués avec des détails à la ♥♥♥ qui sont appréciables que vous en trouverez une ou deux et que vous pourrez pas résister. Non, vous pourrez pas.

D'autant que TRI n'est pas du genre à frustrer, en aucune manière.

C'est fluide, joli, proprement traduit (DIEUX ! C'EST LA DEUXIÈME FOIS QUE JE PEUX DIRE ÇA ! CHAMPAGNE !), proprement envoûtant, proprement génial comme tous les jeux qui ne ressemblent à aucun autre et qui ne se prennent pas pour le messie. Rat King est parti - et ça se ressent - pour faire un bon jeu, ils ont fini la course avec l'un des meilleurs jeux indés disponibles sur le marché. Qu'il plaise ou non - les goûts et les couleurs...
 
Hyeron
3,478 produits enregistrés

Recommandé
41.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 janvier 2015
人間の世界をはるか超えたところに神々の棲む隠された世界があった。
神々のうち最も偉大なものは、小さき形をしていた。
その無邪気さは人をしてそれが神とは思わせしめないほどであった。
これはそうした神々、キツネの物語である。
永遠の祝福が約束された世界で、たわむれる無垢な魂…
…ある日、堕落がお互いを引き離すまで。　　―序幕より引用

人間である主人公が、キツネの神々を救うお話・・・だが、基本的には鍵となる赤のキツネ像を3つ集めて、指定の位置へ持っていくステージクリア型の一人称3Dパズルアクションだ。実質チュートリアルである第一章を含めて16ステージ。UIや字幕は完全に日本語に対応しているので、安心して楽しむことができるだろう。
主人公は走ったり、ジャンプしたりの他にTRIという力を使って、マップ上に足場となる三角形を作ることができる。
物語を進めると新しいTRIの力が増え、なんと壁や天井の上を歩くことが出来るようになる。
ゲームの後半はかなり難易度が高く、TRIを完璧に使いこなさねばならない。そういった点ではパズル、アクションどちらかが苦手な人にはオススメできない。

良かった点
良い点が挙げてもキリがないので簡潔にまとめる。
  • オリエンタルな世界観とその雰囲気にあった、特徴的で面白い音楽。
  • 日本語対応
  • やりこみ要素があり、ステージの攻略速度を全世界のプレイヤーと競ったり、隠された金色のキツネ像を集めれば制作秘話などが聞ける。
  • 全実績獲得が比較的簡単

悪かった点
反面、どうしても悪い点が目立った。
  • マップの外へ落ちてしまった場合は、すぐに元いた位置に近い復活ポイントに戻されるが、マップ上に配置してある緑色の酸や赤いレーザーに触れると「死亡」した扱いになり、最後にセーブしたポイントまで戻ることになる。
    赤いレーザーは、物語上意外と重要な役割（意味）があったが、緑色の酸については「無くてもいいのでは」と感じた。
    TRI: Of Friendship and Madness 
    Une capture d'écran de TRI: Of Friendship and Madness
    Par : Daggshie

    ん・・・？赤いきつねと緑のたぬき・・・？（適当）[/spoiler]
  • マップ上に、重力の働く向きが変わる場所がある。そこへ行けば突然画面がぐらりと揺れるし、その上画面がまるで凹面鏡のように少し歪み、さらにモヤがかかった様なエフェクトが発生する。ただでさえTRIの力で視点は縦横無尽に動くのに画面が歪んだりなんてたまったものではない。
  • とあるマップでは、見えないものを見よ言わんばかりに「透明な足場」がある。ただ、マウスカーソルを合わせればカーソルの色が変わるので見えるといえば見える。
    ただ、問題なのがそのマップの後半だ。同じようにカーソルを合わせればカーソルの色が変わるが、「自身が触ることはできない」透明な足場が出てくる。そこはTRIで三角形を作って進めばよいのだが、今まで透明な足場を普通に歩いていたはずなのに、事前情報もなしに突然現れるので、正直理不尽さを感じた。
 
Daggshie
1,622 produits enregistrés

Recommandé
24.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 aout 2015
TRI is a beautiful game, both in visuals and in mechanics. You place triangles that allow you to climb, walk on walls, and reflect light beams. There are many challenging puzzles, and many cool puzzle mechanics, especially if you are interested in finding all of the hidden statues. The art is very pretty, and sometimes very abstract, which fits the game perfectly. The music plays in segments with silence in between, and while it fits the game, it can get a bit repetative if you are stuck on a level for a long time.

However, dispite all the wonderful things about the game, there are times when I hate it. The puzzles can be VERY hard, especially in the later levels, and I had to look up videos or search the forums in order to progress. When bending light, minute changes in a triangle can greatly affect where the beam lands, and I often placed as many as 30-50 triangles to get the light to land in the goal. (Note: if you use the tab button to fix your head and make your triangles exactly the way you want, you end up with much fewer triangles, but you still often spend a great deal of time making tiny changes) I did not discover the quick save (F5) button until very near the end, and there were times where I would die and get greatly set back, especially when I collected statues since the save. It was not uncommon in the later levels for me to wander around aimlessly for as much as 20 minutes trying to figure out how to progress. Some times I wouldn't pick up on a new mechanic being introduced and end up placing dozens of triangles to brute force my way through the puzzle. Triangles would also place oddly, either refusing to create for no apparent reason, or placing prematurely, requiring more work to get the exact triangle you needed.

And then comes the idol statues. In each level there are around a dozen little statues hidden in tiny nooks and cranies. As an achievement enthusiast, I had to get every one in order to 100% the game. This process would have been excruciatingly painful had I not used the guide (which is awesome). I would have wandered around, spending insane amounts of time backtracking and searching every square inch for fake walls or hidden coridors, constantly worrying about missing something. The time I spent in the game would likely be three times what it is, and it wouldn't have been fun. It was this feeling of banging my head against the wall to find the last idol (sometimes difficult even with the guide) or trying to cross an acid pit that took the fun away from the game and make the last few levels feel like a chore.

I spent a lot of time deciding whether or not to recommend the game, and I finally decided on recommending it, but with this warning: play casually. Don't sit down and think "I'm going to get all the statues in the last two chapter", because you won't enjoy it, it will be hard, painful work. Think instead, "I'm going to enjoy this game" and play through what you get through, and do it calmly. Try not to get overly frustrated at a problem, and if that does happen, take a break! If I had done that, my experience with the game would have been SO MUCH more enjoyable.

For more puzzle game and platformer recommendations, check out my Curator page
 
100% Hippo

Recommandé
35.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 novembre 2014
Note: i did not play 35 hours, probably around 15 or so.

Right from the start i have to say that the game looks beautiful with it's warm looking simple art style, and the great soothing and mysterious original sound track it has that fills the void of your adventure through the game on solving its puzzles.

Speaking of puzzles, they're mostly simple to moderately challenging to finish, and it's really fun with how you can solve them in your own way by creating triangular platforms that gets more functions the more you progress through the game, like having their own gravity so you can walk on walls and ceilings. The game's campaign is also pretty lengthy for what it is, where i thought it would have ten levels max, but it actually has sixteen levels which is great.

The story isn't something to brag about but it definitely is very charming and with somewhat adorable (two) characters, and the ending was a nice satisfying happy one.

The bad things about the game is that there's a lack of a hint/help or a guide system which the game does need in my opinion in late, specifically speaking from chapter thirteen to sixteen, having to spend on one of those levels more so than the time spent on all past levels, trying to solve the puzzles in them. Also there's a problem with motion sickness that one might have during some of the levels in the game which it did get my dizzy but could handle it, but others may not be able to.

I was surprised and happy with how the game plays out with how much content is in it, and how creative their mechanics in terms of solving puzzles is, and overall the general quality of the game being good, seeing as how the price of the game is 15$ on Steam, and I'm happy to recommend this game for what you get in the overall package.

Shameless link[www.ksalue.com] to original post.
 
FreakOrama

Recommandé
38.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 mars 2015
Tri is an atmospheric puzzle-platformer, mixing lovely visuals and immersing music with varied and inventive levels. It's beautiful, and the story gives a reason to press forward through the game, but the level design and the tough but fair puzzles are where the game truly shines.


Initial gameplay is straightforward. Explore the levels, place triangles as platforms, look in side areas for the hidden idols. The game quickly moves into spatial reasoning, with the triangles aligning your gravity with them, giving plentiful freedom of motion. Levels progressively grow more open-ended, giving full use of that freedom of motion; anything you see, you can explore, as long as you can figure out how to get there.
While the game mechanics remain simple, the world itself (and its playful nature about the laws of physics) allows for numerous applications, giving the puzzles a great variety. The levels aren't too difficult to complete, but the idols hidden throughout the world give a reason to really explore, leading one into the most clever puzzles the game has to offer.

Tri is a very relaxing game; the peaceful world, soothing music and calm Monk companion give the game a lovely atmosphere. As for the gameplay, timing-related puzzles are few and far between, nothing can kill the player except static environmental hazards, and the level design encourages exploration and taking one's time.


Personal assessment: Tri is absolutely fantastic. The open level design and integration of the puzzles into the levels as a whole makes the entire game feel like a cohesive package. It's not super long, but towards the end the puzzles are so different from one another that it stays fresh the whole way through.
My favorite moments are the puzzles that violate natural laws to the point that they look literally impossible at first glance, and the puzzles that are so mind-bending that even when past them you don't know if you actually solved it or if you missed the point entirely.
Your Mileage May Vary; many of the puzzles don't have well-defined boundaries or completion rules. While I very much enjoy that aspect, some may find it hindersome when going for full completion. The game is very much worth an initial playthrough, though.


Bottom line: if you have the time to let your mind be melted by a fox and a bunch of triangles, Tri is a great experience.
 
Niflthaena

Recommandé
5.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 juin 2017
奇异的构思，舒服的画面，牛逼的原声
本身作为概念前身的tri有幸在很久以前无意中玩到过那个时候的游民独立游戏区翻看时下载到的 ，当时就被一连串的构思震惊到，觉得手持一把三点成面枪然后利用这个机制衍生出一套解谜机制很有意思，虽然粗糙的游戏画面玩久了有点眼睛累，但是我心中觉得它的有趣不输传送门 当年比较年轻，但是当时只是浅尝即止，也是后面的关稍微有点迷了，就把这游戏弃了
然后，直到我再一次遇到了这款TRI，一开始我是没有想到二者有联系的，直到我闲着没事翻看其设定集，看到里面对游戏前身的介绍，再看到里面带着的那张粗糙的游戏画面的截图，才发现原来二者是一脉传承下来的，比起一开始的实验向小游戏，这回在内核保留的前提下，有了更舒服更好看的画面，有了风格独树一帜的诡异但又无限洗脑让人无法挣脱的BGM，还有了一段没怎么看懂但是满脑子都是狐狸狐狸狐狸的剧情在推动着你的探索，有点感叹当年对游戏还很迷茫随手找独立游戏下载来玩的那段日子
在游戏的过程中，三点成面的能力被不断的赋予着各种解谜应用功能，随着你一次次的运用着自己脑洞创造着属于自己的解法和这种解法带来的属于自己的体验，自己的路线，那种感觉实在是美妙。
同时，游戏中也一直弥漫着民俗宗教的味道，从场景到背景音乐，无孔不入，一股神秘的味若有若无的萦绕着你，你会在探索每一个场景的时候犹如窥探到了那冰山一角的古老奥秘一般动容，喜欢这种风格的玩家那这游戏确实是不容错过的珍品。
建议购买这游戏的，千万购买豪华版，把原声集收入，实在是太可怕了，有这么一个月我都一直在狂听，不听的时候脑子里都自己蹦着这旋律的
还有，这游戏，是有点晕的。晕3D玩家，估计会玩到吐
还有，通关，并不轻松
不过好在社区指南里有国人做的收集视频，真是太好了。
 
GIGA BULLET PISTOL

Recommandé
26.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 décembre 2015
У безумия есть не только лицо... Но и углы. Причем их всего три!
Коротко о сюжете - мы играем за человека, который просто помогает "смотрителю" храма с целью отыскать лисов. Особой роли история тут и не играет - она тут просто есть и рассказывается между этапами. Да и данная игрушка вначале просто завораживает своими видами. Китайская стилистика, простые головоломки и просторные уровни - все наводило на вопрос "А что в ней такого безумного?". Как я, блин, ошибался, когда начал проходить дальше...
В основном, единственное, что у нас есть - это "TRI", которым мы рисуем иллюминатские треугольники. В дальнейшем эта способность улучшается - мы можем ходить по стенам и потолкам, потом отражать лучи... И в целом эта банальная фигня и заинтересовывает всю игру! Каждый уровень наполнен своей изюминкой, поэтому вы вряд ли однообразно будете проходить данную игрушку.
В целом единственный минус под самый конец перед вами будет выбор - либо вы сходите с ума и проходите харкорные головоломки, или вы просто сохраняете свой мозг и живете счастливо. Если выбираете первое, то после этой игры вы будете злобно смотреть на все треугольники, поэтому я вас предупредил.
Любителям масонских заговоров рекомендую!

Évaluation publiée le 20 novembre 2015
Un gioco veramente interessante ed affascinante, sfrutta in modo intelligente l'esplorazione dell'ambiente tridimensionale e lo fa ♥♥♥ uno stile unico e gradevole.

Il gameplay è innovativo, apparentemente è possibile fare qualsiasi cosa ♥♥♥ i mezzi a disposizione, a volte vi troverete a pensare improbabili soluzioni per poi scoprire ♥♥♥ piacere che sono realizzabili.

Da giocare!

-----------------------------------------------------

A really interesting and fascinating game that uses the exploration of the tridimensional environment in a smart way using a unique and pleasant style.

The gameplay is innovative, apparently you can do everything with the powers offered by the game, sometimes you'll think to really improbable solutions only to find that they are even possibile.

A Must Play!

Recommandé
19.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 octobre 2014
Transported to a world of colorful and almost paper-mâché-like surroundings, set to the eerie trip-hop beats of the melody playing and its mysterious sounding eastern strings weaving in and out of your eardrums; TRI is certainly a world of mystique and ancient mystery, and it bleeds with a style that stands out from the rest.

You find yourself in a peaceful garden of zen, a wise robed and masked figure greets and leads you through your relaxing surroundings to the base of a shrine. Here he explains the story of two foxes with a symbolic relationship obviously revered by the people of this temple. As the title suggests, the friendship of these two once playful spirits has been driven to madness and your spiritual guide requests your help in locating and finding out what really drove these two sacred beings apart from each other. As you step through the portal you've been led to, this is where the game takes a twist from the relaxing to the oddly enchanting and mystic world of the Odd Gods.

Your objective for each ancestral act of the game seems simple enough; collect the three shining fox statues scattered throughout each sprawling temple of dream-like obstacles and bring them to their pedestal to activate the strange portal. As you'll soon discover after only a couple short levels, these fox statues all seem to be out of reach. Luckily, you quickly come across the very free-form and useful triangle creating ability. This allows full creativity and endless possibilities with how you construct your spiraling walkway towards each out-of-reach goal.

Lost in these ancient maze-like structure feeling like some kind of wild animal wandering throughout a huge human contraption. You'll weave your triangles into complex structures to create stairs and bridges, and when you look back you'll marvel at a unique pattern of your own making like a proud spider with its completed web.

As you move through through each esoteric structure that acts as a separate stage you'll come across your spiritual masked guide again who pushes you in the right direction and fills you in on the rich lore and history of the world you've become enshrouded by. Who is this masked entity though? He obviously feels very compelled to protect the friendship between the two main fox gods, but his motivation and identity remain decidedly unclear throughout the story.

It's easily the most entrancing and thought provoking setting I've seen for this kind of a game, and it's actually enjoyable to play through to the end which was a bit of a surprise considering my rough history with puzzle-oriented games. I loved the concept of Antichamber and it's ilk of mind-bending brain teasers but just could not get into it. The concept was a mind opening experience but it was soul crushingly challenging, games like that or Portal often times made me feel stupid, I love them to death but I just spent most of the time wishing I could keep going without getting stuck every other room and taking in the beautiful and mind-bending visuals around me.

TRI challenges you just enough but keeps you moving fluidly through its surreal and colorful world, the pacing is impeccable. Instead of making me feel slow and inadequate it causes me to feel crafty and wise like the ancients who roamed its hallways before me, these seemingly impossible to reach spaces become closer to reach as you craft your serpentine bridges and staircases of colorful triangles with ease and just a touch of contemplation.

Throughout the entire journey for the wise and playful Fox god new powers are being thrown at you, and they do a fine job of shaking things up and keeping the pace exciting. Most notable was the acquisition of the wall walking relic which allowed me to traverse the surface of any connected triangles of my creation, even while sideways or upside down. Within minutes I was constructing interweaving triangle stairs that spiraled up the side of walls and upside down against ceilings giving me a serious feeling of vertigo as I hung high from the tops of the palace.

The levels often times play tricks on your mind, and you can catch a glimpse of a fox sneaking by as you turn around and re-enter a room and notice everything has been completely turned upside down. Is it the elusive and playful fox god we give chase to that plays these tricks on us as we navigate the puzzles of the world of the Odd Gods?

This is exactly the kind of memorable sleeper hit I would expect Rising Star Games to take notice of and pick up, and having another strange, beautiful and otherworldly title in their growing library of classics is why they're at the top of my list of favorite publishers right now.
 
CueZero
3,184 produits enregistrés
7

20.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 décembre 2014
Brief overview of the positives and negatives of the game

Pro:
  • + A unique and new mechanic to immerse yourself into solving puzzles. Dare I say even on par with portal if not more.
  • + Further adding onto the mechanic (walking on walls and reflecting laser/light beams) as you progress in the game.
  • + A good range of difficulties to keep you thinking throughout the game.
  • + Really nice soundtrack
  • + Unique cartoon/abstract/colorful environment
  • + Some platforming in the later levels
  • + A decent length to finish the game 5-7 hours (15+ if you try to find all idols)
  • + Interesting traditional asian-like story
♥♥♥:
  • - The last few levels ramp up quite a bit in difficulty (especially if you're trying to find all the idols)
  • - A few of the idols, at least in my opinion, seemed a bit 'mean' (unfair) so-to-speak in trying to find them.

    Overall I really did enjoy this game. I played through the whole game 'and' found all idols without any walkthroughs or guides. There were a few stuck moments but I have to admit this game did a phenomenal job in the overall difficulty. Personally, I have seen most puzzle games either be too easy or too hard (to the point I have to get help with figuring it out or give up). This game, in my opinion, has the difficulty just right so you don't blow through the puzzles but also don't sit 30+ minutes not knowing what to do (I only had a few moments like that and it was usually from trying to find an idol).

    This game really does bring a whole new (3d) solving element in trying to figure out puzzles. I can't really put a term to what it's like but once you get to the point you're walking on walls/ceilings, you will have moments where you forget which way is up or down; I just found it neat sometimes realizing I was upside down for 5-10 minutes trying to do a puzzle. Not sure if it will happen to you but I definitely had "mind = blown" moments with some of the puzzles!

    Some people might find the overall story not to be interesting, but even if you are one of those people I heavily recommend to look past that and play the game for what it fundamentally is: a unique FPS Puzzle. Personally I liked the story (it has an traditional asian story-telling feel to it), but I have seen a few say otherwise so here is hope they will look past that!

    9.5/10
 
Typo Hui

53.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 juillet 2016
Трианглопомешательство.

Среди кучи хлама разной степени паршивости, в "рекомендуемом" было найдено настоящее сокровище - TRI: Of Friendship and Madness - игра, о которой я ничего не слышал. Технически, это головоломка, но по факту - больше платформер, при том что платформы главный герой в основном создаёт самостоятельно при помощи артефакта. Помимо этого, есть ещё несколько интересных фишек, но самая главная, пожалуй, это просто гигантские уровни. Они довольно симпатичные(хотя и чересчур минималистичные) и при этом настолько огромны, что порой становится не по себе от мысли, что на этих пространствах где-то спрятаны десяток-полтора идолов, и их ещё предстоит найти, а они могут быть где угодно. Идолы - небольшие статуэтки, изображающие то ли лиса, то ли енота, держащего в лапках треугольник. Запрятаны они, как правило, в таких местах, что если не искать их специально, то вряд ли найдёшь. Среди этих десятка-полтора есть пара-тройка спрятанных либо в совсем уж необычном месте, либо для их добычи нужно пошевелить извилинами. Своего рода аналог звёзд в The Talos Principle. И так же как звёзды, поиск идолов не является обязательным, но это - вызов внимательности и соображению. Основная же задача состоит в том, чтобы собрать три статуэтки Красного Лиса, установить их в определённом месте и перейти на следующий уровень. Поначалу это даже проще, чем поиск идолов, но чем дальше, тем сложнее и запутаннее становятся пути и к статуэткам, и к их постаменту.

А теперь немного о плохом. Во-1х, сюжета очень мало. Чаще всего на уровне можно услышать пару-тройку фраз от единственного разговаривающего с главным героем персонажа, и столько же в заставках между уровнями, в остальные 99% времени игрок предоставлен самому себе. Никаких текстов и скрытых посланий, в отличие от того же TTP. Во-2х, игра явно затянута. Примерно со второй трети если что-то в геймплее и добавляется, то в мелочах, и практически единственное, что меняется - это декорации. В-3их, не смотря на заявление, что игра, мол, "тщательно протестирована", в некоторых местах можно загнать себя в безвыходную ловушку; явно не хватает контроля над "прилипанием" к поверхностям и активации треугольников; "режиму курсора" недостаёт поворота камеры тем же курсором; наконец, функция zoom'а была бы совсем не лишней. Впрочем, всё это не критично, и не слишком портит основное - геймплей.

Увидев среди прочих тегов на странице игры "отличный саундтрек". решил купить версию, включающую в себя саундтрек отдельно. Ну что ж... Музыка, не могу назвать её плохой, но она сильно на любителя. Приятные мелодии есть, но они были бы ещё лучше, не будь в них всех этих этнических завываний. Равно как и звучание варгана, на мой слух, здесь оно неуместно. Буду расценивать покупку deluxe-версии игры как дополнительный вклад талантливым разработчикам.

Если у игры когда-нибудь появится поддержка VR... Ох не завидую я тому, кто решится проходить её в таком режиме!

Буду ждать следующую работу студии Rat King Entertainment. Может это будет TRI 2?..
 
Almit
640 produits enregistrés

30.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 septembre 2015
プレイヤーは基本的なFPS操作に加え、マップ上に３点を指定することで実体化する三角形（TRI)を作ることができます。基本的には足場として利用します。ステージ内の３つの赤い偶像を入手して次のステージに進むのが流れです。
神社のようなマップデザインと仏教音楽のような曲がアジアンチックな世界観を演出しています。

　全１６ステージですが、ある程度シークレット探しに寄り道したとは言え、クリアに１６時間を要しました。
有名どころのパズルFPSの中では一番難しいのではないでしょうか。
　その理由はまず、ステージのギミックに対してのヒントが皆無で、試行錯誤の回数が増えた事や、１ステージ限定のギミックがあり、それを理解するのに時間が掛かる事。
後半はTRIの角度調整がシビアになってくる事。シークレットを探したほうが簡単なんじゃないかと思うほどです。

　そしてこのゲームはとても酔いやすいです。頻繁に視点が傾いたり、壁や天井を縦横無尽に駆け巡ったりします。３D酔いに強いと自負していた自分も「ヤバい!」と感じる場面がありました。

　シークレットの配置も中々面白く、自力ですべてを見つけ出そうとするのであれば、３０時間ぐらいは楽しめるのではないでしょうか。
意外にも高難易度なゲームであり個人的にとても満足しました。
ステージ内で行けそうな場所を見つけたら、とりあえずTRIです。
 
dog-walker

Évaluation publiée le 15 mai 2015
Wonderful in every way
But first, what is TRI: Of Friendship and Madness, I would say that something very close to mirrors edge, - wonderful minimalist graphics and simple parkour with logical and arcade elements, where with the help of our powers we have to create a platform that will help us get further (however, the creation of such a platform has its limitations, as to the size, angle in which it can be placed, etc)

Pros:
+Exceptional new mechanics which you can't find in vain in other games
+The way to unlock new things/skills as the game progresses
+Difficulty level of the game depends only on how much you want,explore,discover,conquer and how you want to do it
+Soundtrack
+Intriguing world
+Animations,unique world,great colorful minimalistic graphics
+Late levels
+Game time ~6 hours + more if you want to max it out

Major downsides are lacking, so I won't even touch on this issue.

I am really satisfied with this game, it provided me with fresh impressions, surprised me with originality and gave me a lot of fun.
If I were to make a list of the 100 best games on steam it would be on it.

Évaluation publiée le 22 décembre 2015
일단 여우가 이뻐서 샀다 근데 겜내에 여우 그렇게 자주 안나오더라 난 여우가 주인공일줄
게임자체는 포탈같이 3D 퍼즐겜 형식
맵에 점을 찍어 삼각형을 만들어 발판을 만들어 퍼즐을 푼다 그래서 이름도 TRI
삼각형을 적절히 배치하고 없애고 하면서 전진하는게 포인트 각도가 너무 가파르면 올라가지 못한다
붉은 여우 열쇠가 3개 있어서 그걸 찾아서 모아가지고 스테이지를 클리어하는 것이 목표
맵 곳곳에 황금여우? 고양이? 이상한 동상이 있어서 그걸 모으는게 수집 요소다 많이 모으면 시크릿 해금됨

장점은 독특한 그래픽을 써서 게임의 전체적인 분위기가 이쁘다
스토리 진행될때마다 일러스트도 나옴 퍼즐난이도도 삼각형 사용이 익숙해지면 크게 어렵지 않은 적당한 난이도다
퀵세이브 퀵로드가 있어서 부담없이 플레이할수도 있음

단점은 그래픽이 독특하다 했는데 어찌보면 조잡해 보일수도있음 그래서인지 3D멀미가 좀 심한 게임 어지러워서 껐다
큰 단점은 아니지만 스토리는 있긴한데 정말 있기만 한 정도라 딱히 흥미가 가진않는다
수집요소인 황금동상은 생각보다 갯수도 많고 정말 정말 이상한곳에 있는경우가 많다 맵을 꼼꼼히 다 뒤지고 다녀도 전체의 반 정도 밖에 못찾음
그렇게 다 모은다 해도 시크릿이 정말 소소하다.... 겜 제작일지나 일러스트월페이퍼같은

내가 이걸 정가에 샀는지 할인가에 샀는지 번들로 샀는지 기억은 안나지만 일단 정가로 살만한 게임은 아니라고 본다
그냥 저냥 할만한 퍼즐겜 ★★★☆☆ 3/5

38.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 mai 2015
Whoa. Wow. I was really impressed with this game. And really immersed too, where did those 20 hours even go...

At its core, TRI is a first-person puzzle platformer with relatively small levels jam-packed with secrets to find, on top of the main collectibles. The difficulty curve is pretty smooth, but steep; the game expects you to think outside of the box and be very aware of what you can and can't do. There's a ton of clever level design and puzzle design, and a lot of variety too.

There are a few minor flaws; chapter 13 is kind of ehh bad. Dying to acid or lasers makes you reload a save, which seems a bit much. Granted you'll end up saving a ton once you get to levels where you can die just so that doesn't happen, and usually it's only a minor inconvenience, but I don't see why it had to be that way. Oh well. There's also a few too many "hidden behind fake tile" secrets, but they still aren't that prevalent and most of them have some indication.

Other than that? A lot to love. I really can't explain why it's great without spoiling puzzle solutions or the quirks of the mechanics, but it's well worth your time to play. Definitely would recommend, but it's not for everyone, that's for sure.
 
rory

Évaluation publiée le 12 octobre 2014
A first person puzzler with a style all its own. Fans of the Portal series or Antichamber will feel right at home.

Phenomenal level design and puzzles, the ability to create endless amounts of triangles that gradually gain new properties, a beautiful art style, immersive soundtrack, collectibles that unlock bonus content (such as developer commentary, art, and developement notes), and a curious story about two foxes.

One of few times where I felt instantly compelled to purchase. A game to remember the year by and well worth the price.

And for anyone in need of help finding all of the idols, I have created a guide here:
Vulpes and Vertices: An Idol Collection Guide 
Un guide pour TRI: Of Friendship and Madness
Par : Sudaksis
This guide will help you find every golden fox idol and get the achievements associated with them. The idols may be collected in any order but this guide will be ordered as efficiently as possible alongside the puzzles...

Recommandé
129.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 mai 2017
First off, TRI isn't for everyone, It's a puzzle platformer with very complex mechanics when compared to games like Portal.

Although it has nothing to do with programming, It is similar to Zacktronics puzzle games in terms of having high complexity, masochistically hard end-game difficulty, and multiple answers for the same puzzle/problem. Some of you may not like that, but others will certainly love it! As do I!

Many of the puzzles consist of learning the uses and limitations of the game's central tool: The TRI.
The TRI lets you place the vertices of magical triangle platforms onto the environment, If you have ever messed around in Blender or 3Ds-Max, you may have in idea how that works, (and what it can do.) Once 3 points are placed, a triangle materializes. Yellow can be walked on, Red is too steep, and platform vertices can be placed on other platforms- these are just some of the things you will have to learn to progress in TRI.
After reading other reviews I should note that placing TRI platforms can be tedious for some players, but this seems to be mostly subjective, as I said- not for everyone.


The game only has 15 levels (minus the tutorial)
One minor gripe I have is there are not enough early-mid game levels for the player to get used to the TRI, after reading the developer commentary, it seems that there was not enough time to make more levels, so I guess it couldn't be helped, but it would have been nice.


The Idols are proof that Rat King is run by evil geniuses an added challenge to find, and in challenge mode you have the option to either speedrun, (shortest time) 100% (all idols), or optimize (minimum TRI platforms) the level with quicksaving disabled.




Ok, so that's the gameplay, but how does it look?




TRI is one of the most atmospheric and beautiful games I have ever played. Each level set has a piece of music and appearance that conveys an emotion. I just love it.
The story is minimal, cute, and perfect for this setting. And I totally-did-not get all sentimental and teary eyed at the end.
And the monk has just the kind of British voice you would take a road trip to kerbin's north pole with, and that's always good to have.




To sum up, the game has it's flaws, and it's not very intuitive at first, but it's still massively underrated and I love it. If you want a puzzle platformer that is slow paced, hard to master, and rewarding; Then TRI might be for you, but that's just my opinion, and you have the right to disagree with me if you want to. and, you should read other peoples reviews too!


EDIT: also the game has foxes, so if you like foxes, you're covered.
 
arrowsforu (AKA: DefCynodont)

Évaluation publiée le 12 septembre 2016
这个游戏不能算很优秀的解谜游戏，但它却是我最喜欢的游戏！画着三角形来不断修“路”去想去的地方，你能画到哪，你就能走到哪。探索各种奇奇怪怪的角落，搜集金色的小狐狸雕像，真的很好玩。不过收集雕像的过程可能会让人觉得枯燥了点，如果你是成就党的话。我喜欢这游戏的另外两点是，这游戏音乐听着可能有点怪，但是个人感觉很好听，而且狐狸很好看，很可爱！

求求你们快来玩下这游戏，真的很好玩QAQ

Non recommandé
5.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 janvier 2015
To start: I used to add a much longer header to these reviews, but since it often made the review too long to submit, I've opted to leave it on my Backloggery.

Gameplay: Full disclosure: I didn't complete this game. I got to level 12 and just decided that I wasn't gonna play this game anymore. While I have heard discussion over an apparently quite large difficulty spike in the last levels, I didn't care enough to go that far. Why? To be quite blunt, this game is dull. Boring. In fact, for the first three levels, I questioned whether or not this game was even gonna be a puzzle game at all. In fact, I still kinda question that even after the fact. Let me go into details for the mechanics first before I start discussing why I don't think the implementation is very good.

Tri is a game about building triangles to solve problems. Essentially, you can create a triangle within a certain volume of space using three points which have to be connected to a wall. While you can't just stack triangles on triangles horizontally forever (in fact, there's a limit to this just due to the way triangles work), this does mean that you can put triangles most anywhere in the level. Unfortunately for the game, you can put triangles most anywhere in the level, meaning that solving a puzzle just becomes a matter of throwing enough triangles at the problem until it just kinda solves itself. This is my biggest problem with the game, and why I found it to be so boring. Never once throughout the game did I solve a puzzle and actually feel clever about its solution, which for a puzzle game can be an absolute killer. There are challenges that you can do which would want you to finish the area using as few triangles as possible, but it still stands that the core of the gameplay just isn't compelling enough to want to do these challenges.

Various gimmicks are introduced as you continue through the game, such as wood-paneled walls which you can't put triangle vertices on (because reasons), light reflection, death lasers and acid. This game also handles death in a really weird way; falling down a pit just respawns you at whatever location the map maker decided to respawn you at, and falling in acid or walking into a death laser actually causes you to die, forcing a load game. This game doesn't really autosave all that well, meaning that once you get to a section featuring such things if you are not manually saving quite often, you can lose a good deal of progress. You can use triangles to reflect the lasers (and in fact are required to do so to complete some tasks in the level), but it's super finicky and often just becomes a question of moving a vertex a centimeter or two in order to solve the puzzle, which as you may guess isn't too particularly fun either. It's especially not fun whenever a certain challenge in a certain level that introduces death lasers requires you to reflect said death lasers around yourself in tight corridors around walls, fearing risk of game over and lost progress unless you quicksave all the time.

The level design is presented in a semi-linear way in that you have a fairly large level in which you spend a lot of time setting up ramps so that you can run up walls and maybe find where you have to go. Each level has three fox statues and any number of small fox idols; the former of which are required for completing the level and the latter are just for unlockable material, usually concept art. Each of the three foxes has their own "puzzle area," which is pretty much just an area where you do some vaguely puzzle-y things in order to get the fox statues. The fact of the matter is that this game really is an exploration game at heart, just with some kinda wonky puzzle mechanics thrown in there. If you're into that kind of thing you'll probably really enjoy this game, but I want something compelling. Maybe The Talos Principle spoiled me for puzzle games, but the degree of compelling exploration and puzzles I felt in that game just isn't here.

That's ultimately my biggest problem with this game; it didn't do enough to get me to care. I can tell that the team cared about the game; it's just that they didn't get me to care. Again, if you're into exploration games with some puzzles here and there, you'll probably have a better time with this game. If you're going into this expecting super clever puzzle design along the lines of games like Portal/The Talos Principle/Antichamber, just go play those games again. You'll have a better time over there. 5/10.

Story: There's kind of a story and kind of a narrator, then there was something about two fox buddies and strife; I dunno. I gotta be honest, I was yawning too much because of the gameplay to really pay attention to the story. As such, I'm not gonna rate it.

Graphics: As I've said in many reviews before, I'm a sucker for big architecture. This game definitely has some big architecture, but something just feels... off about the map design. I think it's just because it's a bit too blocky and inorganic for my liking, which admittedly is most likely a function of the way the game works, but I would've liked to see some more complex geometry here and there in the level design. The texturework is probably part of what throws me off as well. Ultimately, the biggest kicker with the level design is that it just feels like levels. It doesn't really often feel like you're exploring a world; you're just going through rooms. This is again something that the "big three" mentioned above may have spoiled me on, but I do think it's very important for puzzle games, when having a narrative, to have solid world design and not just solid level design. That, in my eyes is the biggest failing of this game as far as an art style goes. It sure has its style, but it doesn't feel... "natural". As far as the technical stuff goes, you've got some graphics sliders and your standard resolution options. It's been too long for me to remember whether this game launches at 1080p, but I seem to recall it doing so. There's also a really weird, grainy overlay that the game does which you may wanna turn off if it bothers you as much as it did me. This is again one of those things where I can plainly see that they put effort into this and really cared about their work, but it just doesnt' really have much depth to it as far as the graphical side of things. Beauty is skin deep with this game. 2/5.

Sound: The soundtrack for this game isn't all that bad; I just wish the game would make up its damn mind when it wanted to play the songs. During your time in a level, the "theme" for that level will just kinda start and stop whenever it feels like, which if you're anything like me, is really quite annoying. The songs themselves are quite bouncy, "ethnic" (I'm sorry, but I really couldn't think of a better adjective), and generally fun to listen to. It's just too bad the game can't figure out when to and not to play it. As for the voice acting and sound design, the voice acting is meh and the sound design is functional. Overall not bad, but I would rate it higher if the game didn't make me absolutely sick of some of the songs. 2/5.

Overall scores are: 5/0/2/2; cumulative score of 4.7/10. It's right around the borderline between a recommendation and not a recommendation, but it's the overall lack of substance in nearly all respects that kills it for me. It's great for the first hour and a half, then you start realizing that it's pretty much just the same stuff over and over.
 
TechiRef

Évaluation publiée le 9 octobre 2014
Des tours fines conçues comme des labyrinthes. Le design est définitivement Zen, couleurs apaisantes et des formes simples.

Tri est un jeu autant plateforme que puzzle, une fois de plus c'est à vous qu'il appartient de manipuler le monde pour rendre certaines zone accessibles. Pour ce faire, vous dessinez des surfaces triangulaires dans ce monde en 3 dimensions, comme des plaques ou des ponts, pour accéder à certains endroits.

Le but est de retrouver un Dieu renard... je n'en dis pas plus. Dans chaque niveau à vous de trouver les clés pour avancer. Le tout étant chronométré.
Rien à redire sur la traduction, Tri vaut bien ses $10.00, un bon moment et une expérience complète.

29.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 décembre 2016
A friend drew my attention to this game. At first I was a bit sceptical because of the art style but in the end I decided to give it a try since I love puzzle games.

And wow, it was definitely worth it!
The game just feels like a little piece of art. The music and style of art fit well together, the game has a smooth learning curve, easy enough at the beginning so that you won't become frustrated while learning the basic mechanics with increasing difficulty the farther you get. In the last levels the difficulty increases even more, I had some problems there but I wouldn't say it's undoable - you just need to take your time.

It's really a shame that this game didn't get the attention it deserves.
This also brought me here to write that review, so maybe some people who think about buying this can be convinced.
The game is definitely worth it and I want to thank all the people who worked on it (the two people behind RatKing, the composer and all others that contributed).

I read that you are working on another steam game and I wish you all the best for it, you definitely deserve it!
I will keep my eyes open and look forward to see more from you :)!

Évaluation publiée le 23 septembre 2015
LEVEL 1

" Oh look I have the tri. I can make triangles."

" I can walk on the triangles."

"Ok need three fox statues to make it to next stage"

LEVEL 2

" Oh goodie I can fall to my death if I don't place triangles at the right angle. Mental note to self red triangles bad. Yellow good. "

" Need three more fox statues. "

LEVEL 3

" Look at me i'm dancing on the ceiling."

LEVEL 4

" I'm pro at this. Maybe I should start recording since I'm so damn good at this."

LEVEL 5

" Don't care much for those tri proof surfaces. What do you mean my triangles have a stretch limit?"

LEVEL 6

(Starts sweating profusely, migrane starting to develop)

LEVEL 7

" Ok I evidently need to get over there, but how do i get over there."

( One hour later )

" I need to get there, I can see where I need to go, but how for the love of all that is holy, how do I get over there?"

(One hour later)

" Ok evidently standing here scratching every shred of hair off my head, mumbling incessantly i need to get over there isn't working. I know let's look around..."

(Four hours later)

" I have covered every square inch of this fruiting map and still can't find a way over there. This stupid temple is littered with 4,000 of my triangles. The whole temple is now cursing yellow. Why can i not get over there? How on Earth can one get over there? Must not cheat, need to calm down, I need to go to my mind palace. "

(10 hrs later)

" My mind palace is ransacked, shut the hell up about foxes you old man just tell me how to get over there or I will stab you with my pointy triangle. Ok that's it I'm cheating. A man can only bare so much. I'm not a cursing NASA super computer you know."

(watches you tube video)

"Your kidding. Is that it? That's all i needed to do? Ok brain you have evidently failed me. You hate me and I hate you. After I have finished this level i'm killing you with beer."

(1 hr later adding another 100 triangles to my now yellow temple I get over)

LEVEL 8

( Passes out at the sheer exhaustion of the momentous task that lays before him )

46.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 janvier 2017
+音乐非常优秀，非常有特色（强烈建议一并购买soundtrack DLC）
+美术很舒服
+场景设计和美术音乐等制造出一种迷の气氛
+把一个有趣的机制发挥出各种花样谜题
+探索感强烈，沉迷于满世界寻找黄金招财猫不能自拔

-autosave点太少，还有为何摔下虚空能自动复活掉进毒液红光烫死不能自动复活？
-游戏做的比较糙，教学引导和防止智障玩家走弯路的考虑严重不足。比如说：
  1. 有个地方的门和木箱等宽，我狗屎运正好举着木箱没两次就穿过去了就以为解法是运箱子，结果下一个同宽的门怎么也怼不进箱子，看攻略才发现设计上不是用木箱解的……把门弄小点让我压根怼不进箱子就不至于走弯路了……
  2. 有个地方需要跳进一个更低的地方并且跳后蜷身（ctrl）才进得去，不看攻略我意识不到往下跳也可以ctrl……
  3. 那个能走的激光除了颜色更深外没有任何提示，智障如我想不到……
  4. 虽然之前的场景教给了玩家狐狸踩可以连锁消去三角，但智障如我不看攻略想不到可以用三角诱导狐狸走动……
  5. 我一直不确定我到底能跳多高（判定问题）导致已经解开的地方我以为还没解开……
-判定不明：偶尔三角画的比较扭曲的时候这一次踩得上下一次又踩不上，没准；有时能跳上4格高度有时只能跳上2格，没准（有个谜题需要跳上3格高度，我一直以来以为只能跳2格高，不看攻略完全想不到……）
-一些设计过于繁琐无谓：后期的反射光弹和激光感觉有些过分麻烦，你想到了怎么解也得吭哧吭哧调半天……；有些移开墙砖后有招财猫的地方毫无提示，就靠满墙乱摸，感觉没啥意义……

尽管毛病一大堆这个游戏还是位列我最喜欢的解谜游戏之一，又爱又恨，痛并快乐着……
 
Ericcil

19.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 mai 2017
Brilliant fps puzzle game.
- Unique mechanic. Tasteful design. Tranquil music. Solid lore and backstory.
- Straightforward main puzzles with rising difficulty.
- The collectibles are practically the hard mode, finding them takes patience and getting them all can be really challenging. (Most of them are tied to hidden achievements as well). So the player is free to choose how deeply to explore a level.
- Levels vary in their concept but all of them revolve around navigating spatial objects. Towers, pits, stairs, bridges, labirinths. It is great how all of them make use of the base mechanic of the game.

Which is by the way so sell designed. Limited but instinctive, pohished but with a little space left for cheesing some situations. And the puzzles themselves stumped me just the right amount before I realized a solution. Only a few game can do this right. They usually put too much obstacle b/w finding the way and actually letting you get to it. Here the two comes hand in hand. This game never left me feel cheated or stupid. Finishing a chapter felt really satisfying. Grat for the devs for a great game.

I think I found my new favourite game.

If you're the kind of player who wants to explore every nook and cranny, this game is for you. The more insanely complicated path you can build, the better. P.S. The soundtrack kicks ass!

WARNING: If you tend to get motion sickness (like me), appriach this game with caution.

Recommandé
31.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 octobre 2014
Tri is a very very good game. It is a puzzle-exploration game. In each level there is a locked teleporter, which require three keys to open. Your task in each is the find the keys, find the teleporter and continue to the next level. Off course things do get complicated as you go along. To help you navigate the levels, you get the "Tri" - an artifact capable of producing triangle. The triangles can be created anywhere, as long as each corner is anchored somehow, and they are not too large. As you go along, the "Tri" can be used in more or less three ways - to create platforms, to be used to walked on walls and ceilings (dont ask...) and to bend light. The use of the "Tri" is fundamental to complete the levels.

There are in total 16 levels in the game, and if you know exactly where you are going and doing, some of them can be beaten in 10 min or so, though others require 20 min just to walk from start to exit through mazes. However, this is if you know the puzzles already, your first play through expect to spend 20-60 min on levels just to solve them. Added to this, there are an x number of idols hidden on each level, some of them very devious. These are not required to finish the game, but you unlock concept art and such by finding them. Finding all will take a lot of time searching and head-scratching.

The game in not "trippy" as such, it is in fact quite serene. The mood of the game is peaceful, and it is much more cerebral than twitchy. The puzzles are logical, and the physics are 'real', so do not expect any subversive puzzles like Antichamber. The game is very highly recommend.
 
amok
0
9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

It's definitely a game that's easy to lose time in. I think I spent $15 on it, would spend $15 again. I'm excited to see what the developers are coming out with next.

20.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 octobre 2014
I'm gonna keep this simple as I'm itching to get back to it, but bottom-line: Incredible. Absolutely phenomenal.

On my Day One list as I bumped into it at EGX, and after several times of trying to stop, I just could not put it down.

It starts of simple. Create triangular platforms.
But if simply creating your own platforms to get where you want isn't that interesting to you, then Chapter 5 onwards gives plenty more to play around with. Mind-bending stuff from then onwards.

I also urge you to hunt down every single golden Idol. Most are hidden or out of reach, but a few per level are incredibly deviously placed, and reward your curiosity.

Please bear in mind that if you had trouble with Portal and its screen twisting during portaling, this will cause the same thing.

However if you had no issues with that, then BUY this immediately.

And imagine if Rat King can get out some level packs, or even a Level Editor/Workshop support...

19.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 avril 2015
Mein ausführliches Review findet ihr auf meinem Blog, aber einen Auszug gibts direkt hier auf Steam:

http://polygonien.de/2014/10/indie-review-tri-of-friendship-and-madness/

Die Idee von TRI ist ebenso simpel wie genial. Recht früh im Spiel bekommt ihr das namengebende TRI, ein magisches Artefakt, dass euch erlaubt, fast überall in der Spielwelt Dreiecke zu bauen, die euch dann als Plattformen und vieles mehr dienen. Diese Fähigkeit müsst ihr dann nutzen, um drei, im Level versteckte, Statuen zu ergattern, die dann den Weg ins nächste Kapitel öffnen. Das mag zunächst einfach klingen, doch die Level werden stetig komplexer und in den späteren Kapiteln müsst ihr oft um weit mehr als nur eine Ecke denken.

...

Mit TRI: Of Friendship and Madness hat das sympathische Duo von Rat King einen einzigartigen 3D-Puzzler geschaffen, der selbst Genre-Liebhabern ordentlich Kopfzerbrechen bereiten kann und das ist im Grunde auch seine einzige Schwäche.

0
Non recommandé
5.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 décembre 2019
Don't be fooled by the pretty screenshots and positive reviews, this game is TEDIOUS.

Levels are comprised of uninspired rooms that require you to build your own platforms and paths to find 3 main McGuffins, that the game calls idols, to progress. There are also numerous optinal ones throughout each level too. Spotting a potential hiding place for an idol is followed by boring clicking to create a path of Tris to get you there.

Portal and Q.U.B.E. get this right, you can be stumped on a puzzle for a while, but once you've figured it out you're done in a few clicks. In TRI there is no puzzle; you decide where you want to go, then spend several minutes clicking to build your paths and platforms.

Puzzle games are supposed to be about figuring the puzzle out, not the drudgery of enacting the solution.
 
Xune
1,061 produits enregistrés
