Jamro2000
1,247 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
20.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 avril 2020
Incredibile puzzle game ♥♥♥ atmosfere mozzafiato e illusioni.
Molto difficile da completare, bisogna pensare arditamente fuori dagli schemi per figurare la prossima mossa da compiere.
I primi livelli sono semplici e di durata veloce, ma sia tempo che difficoltà aumentano esponenzialmente ♥♥♥ i progressi!

A mio parere potrebbe addirittura competere ♥♥♥ Portal, visto che la meccanica dei triangoli gravitazionali e dei raggi è ben messa a punto (ma può migliorare) e offre infinite possibilità di risolvere una mappa, anche perché i triangoli creabili sono infiniti, seppure di dimensioni limitate.
Può risultare molto frustrante cavarsela in alcune imprese o trovare il percorso giusto alcune volte, perciò è da tenere a mente che si ha a che fare ♥♥♥ uno dei puzzle games più difficili esistenti, ma soprattutto che bisogna sempre ricordarsi di salvare la partita ogni momento per evitare di dover perdere tempo a causa di errori (l'autosave non vi salverà da tutti i problemi).
Cosa ho gradito
° Musica immersiva sensazionale. Avanzando nel gioco le soundtrack migliorano;
° Atmosfera mistica, che unita alle ottime proprietà grafiche, da l'illusione di essere all'interno di un sogno profondo.
° È intrigante affrontare alcuni labirinti e scoprire stretti cunicoli da percorrere, per alcuni però, può essere claustrofobico;
° La giocabilità è ottima e migliora aumentando il FOV nelle impostazioni, buoni controlli per tastiera e mouse;
° Gli enigmi sono davvero creativi e, in alcuni casi, al limite della follia.
Sviluppatori: cosa migliorare?
° Importante: Manca un'opzione per impedire ai triangoli in costruzione di apparire automaticamente quando il personaggio li tocca;
° Anche completando il gioco, non è possibile scegliere di giocare un livello precedente, bisognerebbe per forza ricominciare un'intera partita. Nel frattempo consiglio ai giocatori di salvare un nuovo slot ogni volta che si sblocca un livello;
° Nel livello 14 "Going Astray" ci sono due strutture cubiche di legno vuote e fluttuanti, da scalare per raggiungere l'altare dove si mettono le volpi. Queste strutture (situate nel punto più alto del livello, vicino ad altre strutture simili) si possono scalare solo mettendo una cassa sotto di essi, ma se per sbaglio la cassa vola via? In quel caso si rimane bloccati e bisogna rifare tutto! Aggiungete un pulsante per far riapparire la cassa!;
Consiglio TRI
A chi vuole provare un puzzle game basato sulla fisica e matematica, che richieda una marcia in più in quanto a difficoltà, rispetto ai titoli più giocati di questo genere;
A chi piace esplorare ambienti onirici e misteriosi;
A chi vuole sfidare la confusione dovuta ai cambi gravitazionali e (in pochi punti accade) alla trasformazione improvvisa dell'ambiente!
Non è un gioco adatto a tutti: ci vogliono tempo, serenità e pazienza per godere della migliore esperienza.
 
Art847proudtax
169 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
22.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 avril 2020
Unique and original exploration puzzle game that allows you to literally build your own way through the level however you like.

The game has three main mechanics that are unlocked at certain points of the game, but most of the levels have their own new small mechanics. Overall, level design is great and will truly test your spacial orientation skill!

Most of the mandatory puzzles are not really hard but some have many ways to solve them thanks to the overall freedom of the gameplay.
The levels also have hidden optional collectibles (idols). I'd say finding them is a huge part of the gameplay, as some of them are hidden in a very clever way and have puzzles with unique mechanics you won't find in story puzzles.

♥♥♥♥:
some idols and story puzzles require execution and pixelhunting. It is not a huge problem because it is possible to ease some of them with careful planning. But it can get tiring.
blur and color shift/distortion effects are sometimes too intense with no way to lower or remove them


tl;dr: great game with lots of content (more than 20h of gameplay trying to find as much optional collectibles as possible by myself)
It is neither portal, nor myst. A mix of both with some unique ideas, masterfully executed.
 
тhe Uתsͽͽing Eye
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
2.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 mars 2020
Jogo bonito, gameplay interessante com essa mecânica de criar os triângulos, mas é basicamente isso de pontos positivos que eu vi.

No começo o jogo é prazeroso, com puzzles interessantes e fases bem feitinhas; mas depois ele fica beeem confuso e com fases feitas de uma forma que você não tem muita noção do que fazer e de pra onde ir.

Eu achei que o jogo vacilou na dificuldade e forma com que as fases do meio da gameplay pra lá ficaram, e acabou passando de um jogo relaxante e bonito, pra um jogo frustrante e cansativo.
 
diegao
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
19.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 février 2020
Can't believe I didn't review this earlier. One of the most under-the-radar and underrated first-puzzle games I've ever heard of. Brimming with excellence, deserves to be mentioned in the same breath as Portal and Antichamber. It's an early indie effort so it has some rough spots, but the concepts at play more than make up for it.
 
Teuthex
875 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
34.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 janvier 2020
An immersive and magical gaming experience, TRI has grown to become one of my favourites. This is very different to any other game I have experienced and I really enjoyed the puzzles and the amazing movement through the level. It's really brilliantly conceived and realised in the way, with just a couple of thoughtfully placed triangles, first your wall, then your ceiling (which is now your wall) can each become your floor until you are standing on what was only moments ago, the ceiling.

The puzzles are challenging, often borderline frustrating, as many of the more challenging puzzles in these games often truly are, but I never lost hope or gave up and find that 99% of the time perseverance and regular breaks always enabled me to find a way to the solution in the end.

I am not sure how far in I am but after more than 30 hours playing I have thankfully had no trouble with glitches or bugs (that I am aware of anyway!). Everything about the game is engrossing, challenging and, above all, a recurring pleasure to play.

At its current price (Christmas 75% off) it is an absolute steal. I recommend you snap it up. I can almost guarantee you will be ecstatic that you did.
 
Gabriel

182 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
30.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 aout 2019
I really have to hand it to the makers of TRI : I've never played a puzzle game which continued to take such huge learning steps on each and every level like this. Sure, there are plenty of instances in Portal, Talos Principle, Qbeh, etc. where you have to think outside the box, but in TRI, that ingenuity seems ten-fold every time you start a new room. And those new concepts are COOL.

However, the game can be frustrating. Not bad, glitchy, or too hard: just too long at times. Accomplishing some tasks are a definite slog, and that seems odd to me. I've spent an hour or so trying to reach and solve some puzzles in The Witness, and never got tired of them like I did playing this game. NOT tired enough to give up, though. TRI is a must-have addition to a puzzle-gameplayer's library!
 
Pro-Zak
445 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
33.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 juillet 2019
This is a unique and fun gem of a game. Don't be put off by the first two levels. This is not a game where you simply crawl and jump your way to each goal. You soon get the ability to create you own triangular platforms, and later gain the ability to use these triangles to walk on walls and reflect light rays.

New mechanics are gradually introduced throughout the 16 or so levels, and seldom outstay their welcome. The game sees you collecting three red fox statues in each level before moving to the goal, but the completionists can also find a number of golden statues.

The audio and visual design lends the game a strange, otherwordly feel. The story is told via narration at certain locations and isn't especially well developed, but interesting enough and it gives the world some context.

I had fun with TRI and hope you do to.
 
Solo-Ion
243 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
11.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 mars 2019
I enjoyed this game a lot! The puzzle progression is interesting (it's exponential, but you can solve them after some thinking), the game mechanics are interesting, but sometime the light reflection can become a little confuse, but nothing that would destroy your experience. The story is well told, if you pay attention to your monk guide and don't skip the intros. The levels range from simple (2min to finish) to more complex (1h or more to finish). The graphic is quite nice, somewhat charming. Sometime the game gets laggy on my computer, but nothing that ruined my gamethrough. Overall I recomend it for its full price if you are a puzzle fan.

Recommandé
16.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 décembre 2018
Excellent, absolutely incredible. My only complaint is that it ought to come with a few QoL changes - for instance, the ability to quickly paint smaller triangles under your feet while running on a flat surface, instead of having to stop every so often to make a new one and hoping you don't fall off. The puzzle-solving's fine, but the moment-to-moment gameplay is occasionally tedious, especially when it comes to lasers. The lasers require little thought but a lot of work to get where they need to go sometimes. Often this tediousness would cause me to simply not start the game or quit when I finished a puzzle not because I wanted to stop solving puzzles but because I wanted to stop executing my solutions.

Totally worth its price.

姜Jampin
83 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
20.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 juillet 2018
Il fallait l'avoir cette idée ! Dans TRI, vous avez le pouvoir de faire apparaître des triangles à volonté, dont les pointes doivent obligatoirement être rattachées au décor. Une fois en place, vous pouvez marcher sur ces triangles, et adhérer à leur surface de sorte à pouvoir marcher sur les murs et même vous retrouver la tête en bas. Gare à vous toutefois de ne pas faire un pas de côté ou de faire malencontreusement disparaître le triangle sur lequel vous vous trouvez, car alors la gravité vous rattrapera et ce sera la chute (la hauteur n'est pas létale).
Cette mécanique vous permet de jouer sur la verticalité de chacun des 18 niveaux, et d'explorer tous les recoins pour trouver les 3 statues de renard qui débloqueront le portail vous permettant de les conclure.

Et ça fonctionne très bien ! TRI est l'un des meilleurs puzzle plateformer qui soit, et n'a pas à rougir face à un Antichamber. Il est de plus servi par une direction artistique absolument unique, avec un assortiment de couleurs vives jamais vu ailleurs.
Même la musique est spéciale. Bien que trop répétitive (vous finirez par baisser le son), elle rythme allègrement les premiers niveaux avec une sonorité bondissante. Oui ; une musique bondissante.

Si les premiers niveaux peuvent être fini en quelques minutes, cela se corse rapidement et vous passerez bien une grosse demi-heure sur les derniers. Ainsi, la durée de vie est plus que suffisante.

Et, cerise sur le gâteau, il y même une petite histoire, qui sert d'argument pour progresser, avec un moine qui nous accompagne dans les niveaux, et un renard qui apparaît de temps en temps.
 
Nockeim
493 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
18.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 juillet 2018
TRI: Of Friendship and Madness is a puzzle platformer where you manipulate 3 surface vertices to create 3D triangles to traverse levels in creative ways.

That said this is one of the most challenging and thought provoking puzzle games I've ever played. Some of the later levels took me up to 2 hours to complete and sometimes I had to pull up a walkthrough video. After seeing the walkthrough I realized it was just me being too dumb to think of the solution since they were never really complicated. If you thought Portal or Antichamber were difficult then you may get stuck for a while on TRI. Even though the game is challenging it's very forgiving by allowing you to quick save and load at any point so just think of it like having an emulator save state function.

I highly recommend this gem if you want to have fun being creative with game mechanics, if you love ambient or space bending art styles, minimalist stories and playing at your own pace. Also this album goes perfect with this game for getting brain juices flowing:
Vidéo YouTube™: Larry Heard ‎- Sceneries Not Songs Volume Tu (CD) [B50930-1] 
Vues : 60,931
1 Crystal Fantasy 2 Tryblennasense 3 Romantic Sway 4 Techno-Centric 5 Forbidden 6 Solitude 7 Carla's Dance 8 Night Images 9 Ice Castles 10 Nature's Bliss 11 Precious Tears 12 Bongo 13 Night Images...

    Pros:
  • The game is challenging for those who like that
  • The art style is soothing and consistent
  • There are no time limits on levels and you have infinite retries
  • The platforming element is never too demanding
  • The narrator character, although not an A-list voice actor, is charming in his own ways
  • There are extra challenges for bonus content if you feel the main game doesn't have enough content
  • If you're a fan of speedrunning this may be up your alley as it has in game functionality for that
  • There is a small amount of sequence breaking/cheesing you can do if you're into that for puzzle games
  • Puzzles take advantage of multiple elements such as: triangle platforms, gravity shifts, light/laser direction, teleporting, passable/impassable barriers, temporal loops, physics objects, invisible structures and more
    ♥♥♥♥:
  • Some levels have tedious trial and error solutions that suck a lot of time
  • There are very few hints to the solutions to problems so if you get really stuck you may have to look up what to do
  • The music and narrator aren't the best quality so you may be irritated by that
  • The story isn't very impactful to the gameplay so don't expect Metal Gear Solid levels of interaction
  • If you don't pay attention to your saves you may end up having to load from much earlier in the level which can be frustrating due to having to replace triangles in precise locations
  • Replay value isn't substantial if you don't care about bonus developer material or don't want to sink time into solving certain puzzles again
 
Mushintaters

总之游戏基本是选择墙上/地上三点围一个三角形的平台，只要不是很陡的话显示为黄色就能走上去，角度太大变成红色了的话会站不上去滑下来。点是任意选的所以自由度极大，同时也加剧了收集难度，第二关刚拿到能力显示隐藏一共10个我才有6个当时我是懵逼的。

Évaluation publiée le 26 juin 2018
Trite. An overambitious project built around a single interesting gameplay mechanic, with the result that the better aspects of the game are bogged down by inadequately implemented physics, subpar voiceacting, no plot to speak of and next to no replayability value. The hidden creator avatars only become more grating with each instance, as they completely break immersion and serve as a reminder that this project would have benefitted greatly from harsh editing.

47.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 janvier 2018
I hesitated buying this game due to reading about it being motion sickness inducing.
I got it after it went on sale for a couple of euros and decided to give it a try.


The only negative thing I can say about the game is that it gave me motion sickness (decreasing wobble in the settings helped immensely). I sat through it due to the amazing gaming experience I had.
TRI gets harder and harder the more you progress and learn new game mechanics. The idol collecting can be very tricky and some of the achievements are hard to get which is a nice challenge.

In conclusion: really good game

Évaluation publiée le 25 juillet 2017
Las mecánicas, que se basan en ir creando triangulos para poder avanzar, se cargan completamente este juego de plataformas y puzzles en 3D. Si bien la idea no es mala, el abuso vuelve al juego pesado, tedioso, aburrido... los puzzles se reducen a salas bastante grandes y vacías dónde hay que ir creando los escalones, borrando y creando escalones, para llegar a un agujero que han puesto en la parte alta de la sala. Ves la salida y sabes que tienes que hacer para alcanzarla, dibujar un triangulo y despues otro, y otro, y otro...

Pocos juegos me han cansado tan rapido.

Évaluation publiée le 12 janvier 2017
Seriously fun, innovating, and mind bending puzzle game, plus lots of secrets to find. Reminds me of the first time I played through Portal, continually trying to twist my perspective in order to get all the collectibles and make it to the next level. Plenty of levels (at least 15 I think). Music is calming and interesting, and the graphics aren't half bad either considering the simplistic nature of the concept. If you liked Portal for the gameplay, you'll like this

Évaluation publiée le 20 décembre 2016
As a fan of games like the talos principle and portal, this game hits the spot. Excellent puzzles (which I admittedly needed some help with at times - they were pretty tricky) and a really interesting new mechanic in the 'tri' you can create.

My only complaint would be that the voice acting seemed a little amateur, but to be honest it barely detracted from the game once I got into the meat of it.

345 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
1.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 novembre 2016
Совершенно случайно наткнулся на эту игру при просмотре игровых новостей. Привлекла мультяшная графика. Для оценки игры воспользовался пиратской версией. Совершенно неожиданно для меня игра затянула так, что засиживался по ночам до тех пор, пока не увидел финальные титры. Твёрдо решил приобрести себе игру как только увижу в стиме подходящую мне цену на неё. Сегодня мечта сбылась. Рекомендую не пропустить эту отличную игру с её внятным сюжетом, интересными головоломками и неожиданными местами, в которые вас может занести при обследовании локаций игры.

Прошло два года. Рекомендация остаётся в силе. Планирую повторно пройти игру т освежить приятные моменты игрового процесса, благо решения задачек уже успели подзабыться.

Прошло пять лет. Игра всё так же привлекательна. Подумываю перепройти ещё раз.

Évaluation publiée le 19 novembre 2016
Ich fand das Spiel ziemlich gut, wenn es mich auch an vielen Punkten oft aufgeregt hat. Das Erstellen von den Dreiecken und das Bewegen an der Wand über die erstellten Dreiecke fand ich sehr gelungen (habe im Forum gelesen, dass manche Motion Sickness davon gekriegt hätten - ich habe, obwohl ich in "The Talos Principle" aufgrund der Mouse Sensibility Motion Sickness bekommen habe, in diesem Spiel nicht mal Anzeichen davon gespürt). Das, was mich am Ende noch genervt hat, war, dass man die Dreiecke extrem perfekt ausrichten musste.. Außerdem wurden die Level am Ende deutlich zu lang (am Anfang hab ich ca.20min. für ein Level gebraucht, irgendwann 60min., und das letzte Level hat 90 in Anspruch genommen). Fand ich persönlich ein bisschen zu lang gezogen. Aber so insgesamt ein nettes Spiel, was mir deutlich Spaß gemacht hat. Danke ;)

Recommandé
17.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 aout 2016
TRI is fascinating and in its own realm of 3D puzzle games. Much like Portal and Antichamber, TRI forces your brain to work in ways that it...well, greatly resists. =)

The best part of the game is thinking to yourself, "I bet I can get there," and actually achieving that goal, regardless how silly. Frequently, you'll be rewarded with a hidden collectible and a special achievement for your ridiculous ideas and execution.

Don't feel bad if you need occasional help to move along; a few of the puzzles (notably, the very last one on level 16) are utterly illogical and might bring a bit of frustration. The game in its entirety is worth experiencing, though, so push through the rough spots and enjoy its many moments of brilliance!
 
Sad Boi Cozy

11.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 aout 2016
Placing triangles to walk on walls and ceilings is incredibly fun. the music is nice and the artwork is unique. the monk is a really sarcastic guy with a weird voice which I personally think is very funny.the only problem I have with the game that you sometimes fall off traingles with no apparent reason. It can be very frustrating to try an walk on ceilings when there is little space available and you get yourself stuck between traingles. Also, why there has to be a level with blinding light, I do not understand. What fun is it to play a game where you can't see anything and tumble down because you can't see a thing all the time? this was only in one level so far, though.
 
Koen
310 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 juillet 2016
TRI proposes an interesting game mechanic: Using triangles to navigate and 'solve' levels. You use the crosshairs of the screen to mark out the vertices of the triangle, and one is created, and whenever you step onto the triangle, it resets your gravity to be perpendicular to it.
So far so good. This provides for some interesting puzzles and solutions. My one big problem is that the game can get very overwhelming.
Once you get to the later levels they become so large and complex that, when coupled with the fact you're going to be leaving random triangles after you everywhere, makes it very easy to get lost and lose track of your goals.
Also, I don't feel that the game offers much in terms of new game mechanics. It's pretty much triangles all the way down, which can get a bit much after you've played it for long enough.
The music is actually very nice. The graphics are quite minimal [not minimalist] , with simple texturing, which is nice.
So overall, I'm on the fence about this one. But you can see some effort has been put into making this, and if you're a die-hard puzzle fan, you may enjoy this.
 
LM

28.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 aout 2016
Spent three sleepless nights, got red eyes, no regrets. Last chapters are mind-blowind.

If you like 3D puzzles, this is a game for you. Good ol' box carrying and light bending plus the ability to control the gravity. All that walking on walls and ceilings made me pleasantly dizzy. Music is catchy and never boring. Awesome story. Wise design of achievements, got 40 out of 43 in a single run, then additional 3 in less than a half an hour, feels like the game is completed.
 
temporaryname96
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 aout 2016
This game is dripping with style. The moment I heard the first few sparse drumbeats over the opening logo animation, I had a feeling I was going to enjoy this game, and I haven't been disappointed. Also, the music actually *continued into the menu screen* and built into a full song. Super-slick, and a great first impression. This game is polished and really well-presented, the whole way through.

The minimalist art style works beautifully. Ignore the guy who says it's not properly minimalist, it's consistent, and it gels with the rest of the game. I think it's taken heavily from The Witness, and it works really well. Even the hint mode that blooms out the entire screen to show you where your objectives are works with the aesthetic. It feels like it belongs as part of the game universe.

The voice-acting is the one subpar part of the game, I will admit that. The guy who did it has this determined commitment to completely enunciate every single D and T in the entire script, and it makes it all sound very stilted. It's a shame, because otherwise his deep voice would have worked perfectly with the character. That said, the writing is good and the lines are entertaining even with the slightly awkward delivery.

And once again, the music. The music is absolutely fantastic. It has a lot of elements of Australian aboriginal music, and the latest tracks I've been hearing have guitar sounds that are right out of a Tool album.

Overall this game is as much about the experience as the puzzles. I am seriously enjoying it, and I can see this being one of those games that even after I finish it I'll open it up every now and then just to play it through again.
 
Excrubulent

2,864 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 juin 2016
Pretty cool. I quit on the 11th level (out of 16) when I had to start ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ around with the direction of lasers. Way too clumsy. I see a lot of comparison to Portal and I can definitely understand it. But the portal mechanic was much neater. It's easy to imagine portals being a useful thing that could exist, but the triangle thing doesn't really fit into any comprehensible grounded narrative structure. In terms of gameplay it became kind of exhausting to get from A to B. It felt like the player was designing the level but not in a good way. I'm like "yeah I know I need to get there but I don't want to make like 10 triangles i.e. 30 points to get there. Portal involves all the planning but the actual execution is super neat.

The fox story and aesthetics were kind of enjoyable without necessarily being well-crafted. The music was super high quality though. Some of it was like late 90s Crash Bandicoot-y 3D platformer throw-back. Congo drums, kazoos, didgeridoos and tribal vocals and some synth. But it wasn't hugely memorable. Sound design was also very well done.

I guess the best part was level design. It presented a series of really cleverly designed puzzles that made creative use of its core mechanics (minus redirecting the light I actually couldn't tolerate that). Definitely recommend for a few hours.
 
bobby dunst
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
38.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 avril 2016
I first heard of TRI in a forum for Portal, while discussing how much I was glad to have found more Portal content in the form of Portal Stories: Mel. Someone then recommended I try TRI for a spin. I love puzzle games, they're among my most favorite types to play. TRI rewards the unconventional player, and the "outside the box" mindset. In a world with invisible barriers and crappy rocks meant to hold a player in the "playable zone," TRI rewards the player who tries to get to unreachable spots. TRI has implemented mechanics and tools that I've not used in any other game so far, and that was refreshing. It's a fun game, and at times, pretty difficult. But the difficulty turns to sweet success when you figure out how to solve the problems. Bonus idols can be collected as an additional option in the game, making for an even longer playthrough. The art and soundtrack and story are also very well done, and I enjoyed looking at the bonus artwork as I unlocked it. All in all, if I was to recommend any puzzle game, this would be in my top 10!
 
octipuff

32.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 avril 2016
The game that'll get more use out of triangles than your geometry class.

Pretty cool puzzle game, moderately open-ended levels/puzzles (much moreso the later levels) that explore the concept of TRIANGLES quite a bit. Finding the secrets is pretty fun too (all c. Start out making platforms, then you turn into Spiderman, then you reflect lasers (it wouldn't be a puzzle game without laser puzzles), then ???. Foxes are involved somewhere.

Also, lots of credit to this guy's guide ( http://steamcommunity.com/app/293660 ) that shows where to find all the secret shrines, but doesn't really give you the HOW, so as to not take the fun out of it (pretty helpful with how open the levels get).

34.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 mars 2016
Großartiges Rätselspiel bei dem man Dreiecke zeichnen muss, um Plattformen zu schaffen und noch einiges mehr.
Mit ein bisschen Kreativität kann man so fast überall hinkommen, was sich auch lohnt, denn dort wo man zuerst gar nicht denkt, dass es möglich ist hinzukommen, sind meistens die Sammelstatuen versteckt. Den Schwierigkeitsgrad finde ich angenehm und erst in den späteren Leveln knifflig, nur einige Idole haben fiese Puzzle oder Verstecke.

Außerdem ist die Musik klasse und einzigartig, es ist ein genialer Mix aus Kehlkopf-/Volksgesang mit traditionellen Instrumenten und elektronischer Instrumentation. Am Anfang etwas gewöhnungsbedürftig, nachdem man sie aber einige Zeit hört, kann man fast gar nicht anders, als mitzusingen. Die Grafik und die Illustrationen sind auch echt schön, Version mit Soundtrack + Artbook lohnt sich also.

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
15.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 mars 2016
Love this game so much. My only criticism is the voice acting, which isn't terrible, but isn't great. Otherwise, it's gorgeous. The gameplay mechanic is reminiscient of Portal; like that puzzle game, the absence of weapons or enemies is a relief. Not that I don't love shooting at stuff, I just like my first-person platformers to let me focus on the puzzles rather than shooting at stuff. The story is definitely on the meditative side, by design. I love a dark and intense story, but this is a soothing change of pace. Just mythical foxes and magical triangles. It's exactly the kind of thing I'm always looking for -- surreal, atmospheric, puzzle-oriented, exploratory. I'm hooked.

Recommandé
4.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 mars 2016
If I could sum this game up in 1 phrase it's: "under rated gem". The concept for Tri feels similiar to that of Portal however you're using a device that creates trinagles to use as platforms instead of solving things with your portal gun. The problem always seems to be right in front of you and usually if you don't solve it I noticed more often it's your fault and it can be solved by investigating It has it's moments where I felt like "Okay this needs to be a little polished at times" (For example there was a moment when an NPC got stuck in a spot for about 2 minutes because I was too close to them however the problem (while amusing as it was) resolved itself in about 3 minutes tops when I moved away from the NPC.) these small flaws didn't ruin the experience of what I have played as a whole. I'dsay it's price is a tad too high but honestly even that seems nitpicking, the game just seems overall pretty darn good.

Recommandé
15.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 mars 2016
Ok, I'm BARELY going to recommend this game. And that's because it was more fun that it was frustrating crap-fest. But it *was* the 2nd part of that as well.

Pros: Levels 1-13
- Very, very fun and challenging. Even level 13 which was pretty damn hard, but still doable and satisfying, and you at least knew which direction to head in. It took some work and thought, but I loved it and all preceeding levels.

♥♥♥♥: Levels 14 and probably 15.
The light refracting mechanic

- The light refracting mechanic is hyper micro-managing and not very fun. Cool idea, but in practice it was annoying.
- Level 14 is one of the worst levels in any game I've ever played. It was completely convoluted, there was NO sense of where to go or what to do next, and there was a mechanic (yellow box) that straight up wasn't explained at all. I found the exit before I found any of the fox statues. In the end, I watched an almost complete walkthrough. If possible, I *never* look for hints or walkthroughs unless I really have to. It happens sometimes sure, but to resort to a full blown "get me through this entire level" type of thing? No. It shouldn't ever be that hard. I don't mind challenging - it makes it more satisfying in the end, but there's a huge line between hard and stupid. This level is stupid.
- Level 15. I quit after the first puzzle. No, I quit during the first puzzle. It was obvious what to do, but doing it was incredibly annoying. After 14, I said no more.

tl:dr
- Most of the game is really fun and the puzzles are good. Last two levels can fornicate themselves with an iron rod.
 
Ygg

Évaluation publiée le 20 mars 2016
This game is brilliant!

It contained some of the most innovative and mind-blowing mechanics and puzzles I've encountered so far in my history of gaming. Not even Portal nor Antichamber made me love their puzzles and mechanics as much as TRI.

The artstyle is beautiful, the soundtrack is enchanting, the puzzles are challenging and the level design is super creative!

Definitely one of the best games I've stumbled upon in recent years!

Évaluation publiée le 7 mars 2016
I orignally purchased the regular edition because I've always found all that bonus stuff to be nothing but superfluous, unsubstantial fluff, but then I played the game... and heard the soundtrack. And holy hell what an amazing soundtrack it is, so I got the deluxe edition. TRI is the only game I've done this with.

Listen here: https://kingludi.bandcamp.com/

As for the game itself, TRI is a very stylized puzzle-platformer sporting some amazing architecture; a combination oriental vibes and colourful minimalism. You solve puzzles by creating triangles to use as platforms, and as you progress, you gain the ability to walk on these triangles on vertical surfaces, and reflect light off of them. In lieu of this is a story about two gods, a pair of foxes, parting ways for reasons that becomes clearer as you progress. And to aid you with that progress is a mysterious monk.

Gameplay is solid, puzzles go from easy to challening, the voice acting is really good. Overall, you're looking at a quality product, so if you're into first-person puzzlers you can't go wrong with Tri: Of Friendship and Madness.
 
Ephiraal
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
22.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 mars 2016
The game is a puzzle exploration game with a neat asthethic and some excellent music. The puzzles involving collecting fox statues and also bonus idols. The game involves drawing triangles which help you traverse the world and defy gravity by climbing on walls,the ceiling. I have reached level 7 and found the controls some what jittery when you slip from the antigravity walls and the jumping is a little bit cumbersome.The puzzle till now are ok with a lot of trial and error as triangles can almost be placed anywhere. I am finding the levels too difficult due to the use of this mechanic where it is not clear as to exactly what to do.this game requires a tremendous amount of patience. Recommended for the patient puzzler who enjoys exploration and is ready to experiment to figure things out.I got it at a steep discount and have already got my money's worth.

Recommandé
24.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 novembre 2015
I am very impressed with TRI. One shouldn't expect a typical first-person adventure here - basically, you're exploring a multifarious world by creating solid two-dimensional triangles, for use as walking platforms. These platforms expand your access to different parts of the world, a reach that keeps expanding with different levels of the "TRI." It is a very cool concept that keeps evolving, which can certainly maintain a gamer's interest. Also, the music is great. Visuals are clean, and the concept is unusual and interesting. A+.

Recommandé
31.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 octobre 2015
Overall: Very good

Likes:
- Trying to find and collect all the golden idols is fun
- Mostly relaxing, meditative

Dislikes:
- Creating triangles to reflect light beams and kami (trails of light) toward targets is tedious, annoying, and not fun. It takes no skill and barely any thought; it is just trial and error. Fortunately, this is really only an issue on the second-to-last and third-to-last levels.

Comments:
- If you don't try to collect the golden idols (optional objectives), the game world is pretty empty

280 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
15.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 septembre 2015
TRI is a puzzle-platformer that uses triangles as it's core game mechanic. As you play the game you unlock different abilities (such as creating triangle platforms) and use these to collect the three red fox statues that unlock the next level.

The concept of the game is cool, the music is nice and the presentation is amazing. However it gets repetitive VERY quickly and the later puzzles are both frustrating and require a lot of trial and error (I spent 20+ minutes on some puzzles just changing the direction of my triangles). The triangles are difficult to manipulate (although the game does have a fix camera option) and sometimes you'll just slip off a triangle platform (doesn't happen much but enough to mention it).

If Steam had a "Mixed" recommendation then I'd go with that. TRI starts off great but becomes frustrating and repetitive as time goes on. If you're interested in TRI then I recommend buying it on sale.
 
August

Évaluation publiée le 25 aout 2015
TRI: Of Friendship and Madness. Un gioco che mi piacque non appena lo notai, per il suo stile grafico, per il concetto. Avevo già fatto i due Portal, e stavo cercando qualcosa all'altezza. "Eccolo", mi dissi. Al posto dei portali si usano i triangoli, ma sarebbe riduttivo e non corretto dire questo: diversa la meccanica e l'utilizzo. Ci vuole comunque il medesimo impegno, e l'atmosfera aiuta ad immergersi nel gioco; atmosfera che ♥♥♥ quel suo tocco sino-nippo-coreano (eppure nessuno dei tre) mi ha preso subito. Premetto che, quando ho creato questa recensione ancora non l'ho avevo finito... posso già dire una cosa: non lasciatevi sfuggire questa volpe!

Évaluation publiée le 5 septembre 2015
Excellent game. Fun just to explore the weird spaces you find yourself in, building paths to get around just to see what's on the ceiling, or behind a wall, or sometimes apparently out of the level, only to discover ther's a collectible hidden up there!

The puzzles are tricky but not overly so, there's platforming but it manages to not be frustrating, and the art and music style are unique and interesting. It does get disorientating though, especially in one level where you walk on walls AND gravity switches direction! Expect to step off and fall in an unexpected direction. :P

Recommandé
31.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 juillet 2015
Though I know this game is great, I feel a little uncomfortable giving this game a positive review. The art style of the game is very beautiful. The soundtrack is awesome. The game has 15 actual levels, which the first 5 lvls are nice and get more and more demanding in a good manner. After that, the levels start to become brutaly difficult. Especially the last few levels are pure madness. This is because it is not like Portal (1 & 2), which had puzzles, that could be done in a way that wasn't hard to acomplish. I mean because portals aligned to a grid and had not to be put pixel perfect. In this game the triangles sometimes have to be put pixel perfect. There are almost no solutions and walkthroughs, but they don't really solve the problems for you anyway. You would never manage to put the triangles the same way as you might see it in a walkthrough. This especially concerns the puzzles where you need to reflect laser beams and randomly flying light projectiles.

After all this game has real production value but I think most people will not finish the game. But if they do, they will go crazy trying it.
 
SuperPants
134 produits enregistrés

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
19.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 juillet 2015
Between the visuals, the puzzles, the music, and the story, this game is a beautiful knockout performance.

You play the role of the wandering traveler in a strange realm, helping your guide to find what has been lost. I will not say more then that concerning the story as any more could give part of the story away. It has a vibe similar to that of some of the great puzzle games like Myst, Portal, and quite a few others where you are just thrown into this world with a little information and get the full story as the game goes forward.

Graphically, the polish is fantastic. It's a strange realm you are going through. As it states in the game, the rules of the world aren't the same as our own. And it's right. If you suffer from motion sickness, you may want to play around with the FoV and/or limit your play sessions due to how odd the realms can get.

The music is a tad weird, but in a good way. Very memorable and can get stuck in your head for a while. I plan to pick up the soundtrack, which is included as dlc or in the collectors edition, cause I can't get enough of the music of this game.

Finally, the puzzles. Some of them may leave you scratching your head for a while as there is no one way to solve any of them. I've gone through a few levels a few times already and I don't think I've used the same solution twice. I will make this reminder for anyone looking to pick up the game. The Tri can do a few things and if thinks are looking impossible, try walking on the walls or the ceiling and look at the problem from litterally a new view. It can help alot.

As a whole, if this game even piques a little bit of interest, PICK IT UP. The two person dev team behind this did a phenominal job and it is well worth the price to play in my opinion. I really can't wait to see what their next project is, but I hope it's as good as this one.
 
Rasiel Draconis
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
25.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 juin 2015
A fine first-person puzzle game where your objective in each level is to find 3 statues and bring them to an exit portal. You do this by creating your own triangular-shaped platforms which allow you to walk on walls, bend or block light beams, and more to solve puzzles. The setting is like a dreamy addaptation of eastern temples where foxes are gods, and I like how triangles are used as eyecandy too.

Some of the puzzles are very clever, while some others were initially vague about what they expect the player to do. Compare it to Portal for example, where the exit door is easely recognizable and players have to analyze the room through logic in order to find a way to open it. TRI however houses some puzzles that I had trouble finding logical groundwork in, which made me scout some areas for a long time only to find (part of) the solution by chance, which didn't feel so rewarding. The crate puzzles felt a bit 'game-y' and one time I thought the solution I found (strangely moving a crate to a different room) was a bug yet the developer said it was the right solution after all.

On the positive side though, most puzzles in this game felt refreshing and really something else. I liked the gravity shifting, light bending and Kami (little spirits moving in an angle instead of straight like light beams), and the crystals that activate new light switches. Some of the best puzzles were fairly compact yet completely optional as they only give an golden idol (little statues) for unlocking bonus content and achievements.

It took me about 23 hours to complete all chapters, but keep in mind that I got awkwardly stuck a lot in some of them and I tried to grab any Golden Idol that came to eyesight. The first-person controls might not be for anybody, but if you liked Portal (for the gameplay, not for the wits and memes), I'm sure you'll really appreciate TRI!
 
SlazRabbit

A thouroughly enjoyable first-person (3D) puzzle game using player-anchored triangles to create new paths and platforms as its main mechanic.
Some of the sound effects are a bit low-fi (jumping) and the story-teller voice-acting sounds a bit "trying too hard" to me, but the music is weirdly fitting and high quality.
The graphics are sparse but charming. Quite a lot of unlockable bonus content (making-of, commentary) included.

Évaluation publiée le 19 juin 2015
I encountered this game the first time at gamescom and was hooked from the first second.
TRI is a puzzle game, where you use triangles to complete a level.
This premise is a lot of fun and enables a new and fresh kind of puzzles.
Everything is full of foxes, which is amazeballs, the OST is really relaxing and the puzzle design is great.
Completing the game 100% can be slightly frustrating though.
Which is a thing I really love.
Everyone who likes games like Portal or The Talos Principle should definitely play this one. It's fantastic.

Recommandé
44.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 mai 2015
Found Tri by going on youtube and searching for "first person puzzler" as I was in the market for a new one. I love this genre.
While not completely convinced by the youtube video I saw, the game did not seem so polished to me and a bit of a gimmick, reading a few reviews Tri still came out on top for my latest purchase.

From the moment it was installed I have been thoroughly smacked in the face for my doubtful first impression.
Tri turned out to have a story, to be very well polished, have a wonderful art style, made very thoughtfully and leveldesign that quickly escalates to the mental in a good way. :D Making full use of the game mechanics. And it has foxes.

Pro's: Everything. It will challenge you and it will make you smarter. Solving levels is very satisfying and you will want to tell everyone about it. But rather than your social skills it will up your spacial thinking skills. The game mechanics get more and more outrageous every time you think it can't. The bending of light rays is extremely awesome. Gravity is not always where you think it is and whatever you can imagine the dev's beat you to it.

♥♥♥'s: It ramps up the difficulty in a hurry. To the point where it might get a bit intimidating. Not for the puzzling faint of heart.
My brain had to adjust to the game mechanics initially feeling slightly disorientated after a session of Tri. Not so much a fault of the game rather a word of warning. Now that doesn't happen anymore and I'm hooked to the game mechanics wanting more.

9/10 very awesome game.

Recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 avril 2015
If you enjoy first-person puzzle games, TRI has an excellent base mechanic (that appears in the second non-tutorial level) that makes it interesting and much more freeform than other, more rigid puzzle games like Portal or The Talos Principle.

The game has excellent visual aesthetics that you can tone down if they get too much for you (or that you can increase if you want to go through a fever dream). And the OST is extremely fitting.

Really, if you like puzzle games, this should definitely be on your list of games to check out. It's as mad as the name implies.
 
RealSlavicBear
1,346 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 avril 2015
TRI takes something from Portal school of first-person-puzzling, but it also takes from the 'free-form puzzle' style of games - Antichamber, Scribblenauts, even Angry Birds: you have an almighty tool of puzzle-solving, and it is up to you to use it efficiently and stylishly in order to navigate the pseudo-Zen temples towards those precious fox statues.

In fact, there's almost an element of Minecraft in here: nothing's stopping you from refurnishing the puzzle rooms with triangle-based furniture and making your own racetrack along the outer wall of a windmill. TRI takes support on all these genres, and uses it to push you higher.
 
zarat.us
1,729 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
16.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 mars 2015
Grundprinzip des Spiels
In komplexen verwinkelten Räumen nach Statuen suchen. Pro Level müssen drei Statuen gefunden werden, um in den nächsten Level zu kommen.
Optional kann eine, pro Level variierende Anzahl an zusätzlichen Statuen ("Idole" genannt) gefunden werden, um Bonusinhalte und Steam-Achievements freizuschalten.
Um die verschiedensten Räume, Luken und Plattformen zu erreichen, können begehbare Dreiecke erzeugt und an Mauern geheftet werden.
Manchmal muss man auch mit wechselnder Schwerkraft zurechtkommen.

Als Kategorie würde physikbasierter 3D-Puzzler am nächsten kommen.

Sound
Die Musik ist einfach grandios, nicht weniger. Ab und zu kann sie so etwas wie einen "Flow" erzeugen: getrieben von der Musik hetzt man im Raum von Statue zu Statue.

Motivation
Es macht großen Spaß, die notwendigen drei Statuen zu suchen, die den Level abschliessen.
Die tatsächliche Herausforderung ist aber, alle Idole zu finden. Diese sind sehr gut versteckt und man braucht Geduld und Leidensfähigkeit um sie ohne Walkthrough zu finden.

Fazit
Ein herausragendes Spiel, das ich nur empfehlen kann.
 
Krassmann

10/10

Excellent 'settings' and a really good 'save' system, too.

(But if you are prone to sea-sickness while playing 360*-view games, do make sure to eat some ginger before playing this one.)

Quite a few strong points
  • Interesting mechanics
  • Lot of polish
  • No handholding
  • Puzzles require use of a real human brain
  • Simple story that goes along smoothly with the gameplay instead of taking precedence whenever possible
  • Unique music (goes well with the game's theme)

Overall, impressed/10

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
25.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 janvier 2015
TRI is a really wonderful game. It somehow reminds of Portal or Kula World in terms of unique graphics and game mechanics, but instead of portals, triangles can be created, which can be walked upon (even upside down) and reflect light. The story feels a bit placed in japanese folklore with a fox-monk asking you for help in terms of finding his fellow fox, which had gone mad from the power of the triangle. So he sends you to the godly realm to find and rescue the red fox with the help of named triangle power (The TRI).
Game difficulty is challenging, but the game introduces all necessary knowlegde of how-to-play in a very good way, step by step. Later levels really twist and bend your brain, when even gravity shifts and whole level parts rotate ...so you understand why the red fox gone mad about this power ;)

If you like 3D puzzle platformer like portal and like to challenge your brain in spatial thinking... TRI is a must have for you.
And most importantly.... it has foxes in it!!!!
 
TenkoFoxx

Évaluation publiée le 5 décembre 2014
Siamo di fronte a un opera d'arte unica nel suo genere; un puzzle game platformico ♥♥♥ elementi religiosi, mondi interconnessi, capacità esplorativa estrema e una trama interessante,astratta,interpretativa; non sò se usa un Engine proprietario o uno tutto suo, fatto sta che graficamente siamo di fronte a un cel shading da paura, la fisica è estremamente precisa, giochi di luce perfetti e un design dei mondi molto bello, ♥♥♥ questi continui richiami religiosi, oggetti, esseri viventi strambi; le musiche hann orei richiami ai Mantra buddsiti, vi ipnotizzeranno all'istante; ogni livello, se lo si affronta al 100%, minimo 1 oretta ce la dovete perdere per finirlo.


Testato su Linux, non ho trovato NEMMENO UN SINGOLO BUG! Solo per questo merita l'acquisto.

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
15.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 décembre 2014
TRI: Of Friendship and Madness is an excellently realized but woefully little-known game. Early on, you get the ability to create triangular platforms on most surfaces in the game. This mechanic seems simple enough, but you quickly discover that it gives you far more power and mobility than you might have originally suspected.
The true joy in this game comes not solely from the abilities you have, but in how the developers actually encourage you to abuse them. They have strategically placed optional "Super Secret" foxes in locations that are completely off the beaten path. For instance, in trying to break the game I ended up climbing out of a hole in the ceiling of one level, but the devs had anticipated me and I promptly found one of the golden foxes there. There is a fine line between clever secrets and arbitrary item-hiding. TRI manages to fall consistently into the former, making for a constantly surprising and wholly enjoyable experience.
 
Mathespian
0

Évaluation publiée le 26 décembre 2014
This first person puzzle game has it all: unique triangle mechanic, challenging levels, pretty art style, nice music and huge exploration possibilites with no need to hurry. Also the unlockable bonus content with developer commentaries, screenshots and background information was a nice touch.

Évaluation publiée le 28 octobre 2014
For Portal and Portal 2 fans a very good "sequel". The puzzles require less combinatoric smartness than a very good orientation. But you will get fast better at orientating while playing. The level design is very good and rivals the level design in Portal 2. At at least one point it has similarities with mechanics from Antichamber.
I am sure the developers had a fun time to make the levels and they love to challange the player with (almost) impossible tasks.
Really a recommondation for those who want their mind f**ked
 
Progenitus

15.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 octobre 2014
A really unique, well made first person puzzler. The music is good, the level design is inventive, and the gameplay challenging. My only minor gripes are the character designs aren't great and the first few levels are a little simple. Other than those very minor issues this game is excellent. If you like indie FPPs like Qbeh-1, Q.U.B.E. and Kairo, pick this up immediately. Well worth it.
 
Gilben
1,468 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
8.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 octobre 2014
操作方法簡單直覺:
滑鼠控制方向+鍵盤決定行動
1.常見的第一人稱走路(W A S D)、潛行(control)、跳躍(space)， 有時配上操作(E/mouse)

2.沒路時，用滑鼠點上三點，創造三角形平面道路
這三個點必須點在一定範圍內並考慮到斜度是否適當， 才能構成一個可以走上去的金色平面。

TRI的優點:
1.遊戲中會動的角色只有三個：
玩家、一個碎碎念的僧侶、一隻偶爾一閃而現的狐狸
沒有敵人需要分神防備劈砍

2.劈戲過程單純
腦袋可以放空
不需記太多情節設定

3.遊戲畫面
美術造型配色舒服、空間設計很迷人
配色大略為暗紅、深藍、金黃、木頭色 造型設計有東方風

4.關卡內想待多久就待多久
沒有時間限制
玩家可以慢慢品味探索迷宮

5.創造道路探索迷宮很好玩
沒路的地方可以藉由點上三點成平面慢慢到達
是很迷人的玩法
而且只要玩家有辦法
想去的地方都給去
玩到遊戲中段後
甚至還可以走在天花板上

6.搜索狐狸很有趣
除了過關必要的三尊紅金狐狸雕像外
在迷宮裡各個轉角縫隙裡
都可能藏有金色狐狸

7.配樂很特別
有節奏感的調皮打擊樂，
聽久了會上癮

8.沒有血條不會痛
不像FEZ摔下去後 角色還會尖叫著變成屍體
TRI摔下去真的馬上復活

9.適合第一人稱視角遊戲的新手
 
orcia
946 produits enregistrés
0

10.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 octobre 2014
Ce jeu est la preuve que la drogue, c'est dépassé (même si elle a probablement pas mal aidé les développeurs). L'univers est magnifique, la musique hallucinante, et le renard vient sans cesse piquer votre attention, tout en vous mettant au fur et à mesure un peu mal à l'aise. Les mécaniques de jeux sont très intéressantes : à la fois très simples et très puissantes, elles permettent un très grand niveau d'exploration, et le positionnement de certaines des statues bonus montre que les développeurs étaient très conscients de cela. Les puzzles sont très bien faits et forcent à beaucoup se remettre en question, car il est facile de ne pas voir la solution et d'errer des dizaines de minutes dans le niveau à la recherche d'une autre solution.
L'univers est très poétique, et une fois qu'on a le deuxième artefact, le jeu devient incroyablement fun tant le pouvoir qui y est associé est puissant et permet de faire des actions très déroutantes qui détruirons votre cerveau. Je recommande de jouer ce jeu avec un ami ou deux qui vous aideront à travers le niveau et rigoleront à vos dépends quand la gravité, assez libérale dans ce jeu, vous jouera des tours.
Je recommande ce jeu à tous ceux qui aiment les puzzles et particulièrement aux gens qui s'interressent au game design, car ce jeu est un très bon exemple notamment d'illusion du choix, d'"affordances" (l'utilisation de la forme ou de la similarité d'un objet à son équivalent dans le monde réel pour donner instinctivement une signification), et vous vous trouverez souvent à essayer de casser le jeu pour avoir une statuette, et vous devez prendre conscience que si vos mécaniques sont assez puissante, tout le monde tentera de le faire à votre jeu, étudiez donc comment les développeurs ont réagit à ce danger ici.
 
Cpt. Fox
87 produits enregistrés
0
